The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Léocadie  never attended school.  In order to cope with various expenses, she sells cosmetic products from home.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.  In order to meet her customers' needs and to expand her business, Léocadie  is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the AMOUR DE L'ETERNEL group.  This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' demand and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell for her business. Melinda has been in this business for 15 years. Melinda earns more income from selling spices and fruits. Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en: Raafat is a 44 year old married man from Gaza.  He lives with his eight children and wife.  Two years ago Raafat opened his own cell phone store in Gaza.  He hopes to get this loan in order to buy new phones for his store.  He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new phones.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Teresita has a retail shop in which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Veit

texts.en:
Veit, 41, is widowed and resides with her mother and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in fattening up pigs and selling nylon rope for over twenty years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her son is a construction worker and earns approximately 4 USD per day. Her two daughters are employed in the garment factory.

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Veit is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. 

Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Soeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her children would save some money on their transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, Soeurn would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income for the family and to send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em is from Kompong Cham province of Cambodia. She is 43 years old and has been working as a farmer for more than 20 years. She learned this business from her parents who spent a lot of effort motivating her. She has a life partner with her husband and has been blessed with 3 school-age children.
This is her first loan from Kiva lenders. She would like to acquire to sustain her farming business. She will pay for a rented farmland, which she will plants bean crops. And with the rest of the funds, she will purchase fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides to take care of her crops in new growth. 
Mrs. Em’s dream is to improve the quality of life of her three dependent children and provide them a further education.

loans.use: to pay for a rented farmland and to purchase fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Kadek and the other members of the Nyuh Gading (Yellow Coconut) group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize their income. Kadek hopes that through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Kadek will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She already has a sow. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Kadek hopes that the increased income will enable her to save for her children needs for school. Her children are preparing for kindergarten.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
This is Novie, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilson, a security guard, and a mother to her three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Novie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Novie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her store

loans.name: Duc's Group

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1977.  She has 3 children who are in high school and elementary school.  She is managing a small grocery shop right in her house.  Her business was started 5 years ago.   

Since joining our credit program in 2009, she has invested her loans in enlarging her shop.  For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more different kinds of products to meet the demand of customers.

Mien is 30  years old with 2 children.  She runs a tailor shop.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy fabric.

Xuyen is 46 years old with 1 child.  She is running a wood workshop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy wood as material.

Hung is 36 years old.  She runs a small grocery shop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy more products for sale.

Trang is 28 years old.  She runs a wood workshop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy wood as material.

Khiem is 34 years old.  She  sells fresh  fruits in the local market.  She requires a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more fruits for sale.

loans.use: To buy more different kinds of products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Immaculada

texts.en:
Immaculada is a married woman having two children.  Immaculada is 31 years old, residing at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Pervelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconut and corn for sale to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  

Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.  Pervelita has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Immaculada wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien, 29 years old, has 2 children who are at the secondary school.  She sells fresh chicken meat at the local market.  Her business was started 1 year ago.  

Before that, she ran a small metal workshop with low profits.  She has been our client since 2006 and she has mainly invested in her former business.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,819,000 VND to buy live chickens as fresh products for sale.

loans.use: To buy live chickens as fresh products for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been farming in Nakuru town for the last nine years.  He is 58 years old, married to Dorice and they have two school age children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer for the farm.

In the future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, who was born in 1977, has two children who are attending secondary school. A farmer growing rice and raising chickens for meat and eggs, Lan joined the credit program in 2006, using loans to expand her business to support her family. She is now requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy food for the chickens on her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza Del Socorro es una emprendedora que el negocio que tiene es una pulpería, que con mucho esfuerzo la ha sacado adelante desde hace mucho tiempo que inicio el negocio ya que tenía que apoyar en los gastos de la familia y brindarle a sus hijos lo necesario. Esperanza no es la primera vez que se le apoya en el financiamiento para la compra de mercadería para el negocio y aumentarla y que sus clientes estén satisfecho por la variedad de producto. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la de productos como golosinas, gaseosas, verduras, golosinas, bolis, pan, galletas, granos básicos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Esperanza Del Socorro is an entrepreneur whose business is a general store. With great hard work, she has make it successful. She started this business a long time ago because she needed to help out with the family's household costs and provide for her children. This is not Esperanza's first loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business so that her customers will be satisfied by the variety of products she offers. She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of products such as: candy, pop, vegetables, crackers, pens, bread, basic grains, and other items.

loans.use: to buy candy, pop, vegetables, pens, bread, crackers, basic grains, and other products.

loans.name: Concepcion Catalina

texts.es: La señora Concepción se dedica a la venta de calzados de mujer, en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad del Alto donde  la demanda es mayor de mujeres que de los  varones,  en esta zona el comercio es diario y las ventas son buenas, la clienta cuenta con el apoyo de su conyugue quien se dedica a la producción de calzados en todas su variedades en su domicilio, el mayor sueño de la clienta es que algún día sus hijos puedan ingresar a una universidad y tener una profesión, para que tener un futuro mejor, con el dinero de crédito comprara una maquina de cocer para la fabricación de calzados, la Sra. Concepción es un mujer emprendedora y trabajadora se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Señora Concepción sells women's shoes in one of the busiest markets in the city of Alto. Demand for women's shoes is higher than demand for men's shoes in Alto. Concepción sells every day and her sales are good. Her husband helps her; he makes all sorts of shoes in their home. Concepción's greatest dream is for her children to go to university one day and have professions, so that they can have a better future. With this loan, she will buy a sewing machine for making shoes. Concepción is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a machine for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en: Uyen  was born in 1978 and has two children who are  school-aged. Her business which  focuses on selling rice in the local market started two years ago and also raises pigs for meat.  Joining in our program in 2008, she  used loans for expanding her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND  for buying raw rice and buying food for pigs and also baby pigs .

loans.use: buying raw rice and buying food for pigs and also baby pigs .

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es: El señor Heliodoro , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar  las condiciones de vida , el esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva , ya que con el préstamo pasado logre inducir en tiempo y forma y fue todo un éxito , ahora necesita un financiamiento para la plantación de cítricos los cuales están siendo afectado por la plaga de mosca blanca y con urgencia necesita aplicar insecticidas , herbicidas , completo , urea , entre otros derivados , que se le induce para el mantenimiento adecuado de la cosecha de cítricos .
texts.en: Señor Heliodoro lives in the La Concepción municipality with his family. For the future, he plans to improve their living conditions. He is very happy to have the support that Afodenic is offering him through Kiva; with his previous loan he was able to plant on time and it was a great success. He now needs a loan for his citrus plantation. His plants are being affected by whiteflies--a pest--and it is urgent that he apply insecticides, herbicides, urea, and other products in order to provide proper maintenance to his plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina Del Socorro

texts.es: señora Cristina , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo , el cual labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con  los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda ya que ellos tienen varios años viviendo en la casa de la mamá de doña Cristina , ella se dedica a los trabajos de campos , especialmente al cultivo de pitahaya , y esto no le genera grandes ganancias para poder construir de una sola vez la vivienda , lo cual busco ayuda Atraves de Afodenic , para que Kiva con sus programas de apoyo para las personas de escasos recursos pueda hacer  un sueño realidad como es  iniciar a construir su vivienda , en un pedazo que esta ubicado cerca de la parcela de pitahaya . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción como , hierro , cemento , perlines , bloques , estribos , arena , piedrín , etc .
texts.en: Cristina lives with her husband in Concepción.  He works for a private company to help pay for the household expenses since they have to support their children.  Their plan is to build a house because they have been living in Cristina’s mother’s house for some years.  Cristina is a farmer and she grows pitahaya (an edible cactus fruit).  This doesn’t generate enough income to be able to build the house all at once, so she went to Afodenic for help.  Kiva’s programs assist people with few resources so that they can turn a dream into reality,  such as beginning to construct a house on a plot located near her pitahaya field.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials such as iron, cement, rafters, cement blocks, roof supports, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos su horno esta ubicado  en la zona de Alpacoma es casado su esposa se llama Lourdes  ella también se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando viven en la casa de sus papas el Sr. Francisco es  clientes antiguo de la institución, ya que trabaja con nosotros ya varias secuencias, el Sr. francisco solicita el crédito para la compra	 de un soplete para quemar ladrillos y así de esta manera incrementar su producción y por ende sus ganancias, el Sr, francisco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Francisco has a business making and selling bricks.  His brick oven is located in the Alpacoma neighborhood.  He is married to Lourdes, and she also works making bricks.  They have 2 children who are in school, and they live in his parent's house.  Francisco is a longtime client of the Emprender institution; he has worked with them already for a number of loan cycles.  Francisco is requesting a loan to buy a blowtorch to burn the bricks.  In this way, he can increase his production and also his earnings.  Francisco is a very hardworking person who feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a blowtorch to use in burning bricks

loans.name: Los Unidos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Los Unidos está conformado por 7 socias y 2 socios, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, capital de la provincia del Azuay que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador",  es la ciudad cultural del país siendo nombrada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable gentil y mantienen las tradiciones de sus pueblos,  nuestras socias son trabajadoras y muy  luchadoras que diariamente se esfuerzan por mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir en adelante.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nelly, tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años y su último hijo es un bebé de 10 meses, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio. Su esposo labora como guardia, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Nelly labora como ayudante de cocina actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una compañera de su trabajo. Su crédito lo va a invertir compra de pascado y mariscos para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Los Unidos" is made up of 7 women and 2 men. They live in different parts of Cuenca city, the capital of the province of Azuay. Azuay is known as the "Athens of Ecuador"; it is the country's cultural centre, named a UNESCO World Heritage site in December 1999. The residents are kind, gentle, and maintain the traditions of their ancestors. The group members are very hard-working and strive every day to improve their household conditions and to succeed.
Señora Nelly, age 38, is one of the group members. She is in a common-law marriage and has four children ages 15, 12, 3, and 10 months. Their oldest two children are in school. Her husband works as a policeman, and they do not have their own home; they rent.
Nelly has worked as a kitchen helper for three years. She works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.
This is her first loan with this communal bank. She was invited by a colleague. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fish and shellfish to start this business.
Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Quyet  was born in 1959 and has two grown children.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing vegetables and raising chickens. When she has free time, Quyet goes to some neighboring areas to buy scrap products for sale. Joining in our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy food for the chickens and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.name: Mau

texts.en:
Mau was born in 1961 and has two children who attend school.  

She is a famer and her main activity is growing rice and vegetables.  She has been in business for many years and joined our credit program in 2007.  She finds it suitable with her business.  Currently, she is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next cultivating season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next cultivating season.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh born in 1978 with 2 children who are at school age. Being a farmer, she growing rice and raising chickens. Her business has started for 6 years. Joining in our credit program in 2005, she used loans for buying food and baby chickens for next cycle. For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy  food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy  food for chickens.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: Vi  born in 1958  has 1 grown son. She is a farmer and growing rice, vegetable is her main activity to earn  income. Her business started  many years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2005, she used loans in expanding her farming activities. For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,938,000 VND  to buy fertilizer and baby vegetable for growing.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky, a widower, was born in 1967. She has two sons who are school age.  Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. Her business started many years ago.  Joining in our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her growing and raising. She is always in a good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to improve her housing condition.

loans.use: to buy cement and hire constructors for complete building.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh was born in 1978 and has three children who are in secondary school. He is a mechanic. In addition, he raises pigs and chickens to sell to have more income. Joining in our credit program in 2011, he used his loan to expanding his raising scale. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to  paint  his house.

loans.use: to  paint his house

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Ms Hoa is taking a loan for her daughter, Hai who is a student at Thanh Do University. She is studying accounting.  After graduation in 2015, she will find a job as an accountant in a company in Bac Ninh province.  Currently, she wants her mother to take a loan to pay her tuition fee

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam is taking a loan out for her son, Tho, who is a student at Danang Architecture University. Tho is a third year student. He studies in the external and internal decoration faculty. After graduation in June, 2013, he will work as a decorator for a construction company in Danang. To make this dream come true, he is studying very hard to absorb a lot of knowledge. Now, he has difficulty paying for his tuition and transportation. Therefore, his mother wants to take a loan of 14,580,000 VND to solve this problem.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fee and transportation.

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh is taking a loan out for her son, Hung, a student who is studying at the National University for Social Science and Humanity. The duration of his schooling is five years. He will graduate in 2015 with an engineering degree. With the hope of finding a good job, he is studying hard to absorb knowledge.  During his studies, he has confronted a lot of difficulties in paying school fees and buying other supplies. That is why his mother wants to take a loan of 14,580,000 VND to solve these problems.

loans.use: to pay for fee and buy other supplies

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina de 32 años, convive con el padre de sus 6 hijos de 14, 12, 10, 8, 5 y 3 años de edad. Esta numerosa pero unida familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad de Huaripampa, en el distrito de Palca, provincia de Tarma. Rosalbina es una madre ejemplar, además de alimentar a sus 6 hijos tiene que atender las labores y urgencias de su hogar. Y como si fuera poco tiene que cuidar sus cultivos que se ubican a varios minutos de su vivienda.
Ella siembra arvejas, maíz, mashua y papas en sus terrenos propios; y como el trabajo ene l campo es muy ardua, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja y algunos familiares. Pero como no es suficiente tiene que contratar personal operario para concluir con éxito sus cosechas o siembras.
Así también se dedica a la cría de animales como vacas y carneros, de cuyas ventas obtiene otros ingresos.
Esta contenta con su desempeño, por que desde niña se dedicó al campo y es lo que le gusta hacer. Cuenta con una excelente capacidad para comercializar sus productos a compradores de la ciudad de Lima. Así asegura sus ventas al por mayor sin correr el riesgo de ver malograr su producción. Sería su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “La Libertad de Huaripampa”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que siente identificación. De obtener el crédito, ella podrá adquirir 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar una siembra. Gastará 1100 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Rosalbina, age 32, lives with the father of her six children, ages 14, 12, 10, 8, 5, and 3. This large but united family lives in their own home in the Huaripampa community, in the Palca district, Tarma province. Rosalbina is an exemplary woman; on top of caring for her six children, she has to tend to her home. And, as if that were not enough, she has to care for their crops, which are located several minutes from their home.
She sows peas, corn, mashua and potatoes on her own land. Because the work in the fields is very arduous, she has the unconditional help of her partner and some family members. However, this is not enough; they do have to hire workers to help with the harvest and sowing.
Rosalbina also raises animals such as cows and rams, which she sells for an additional income.
She is happy with her work, since she has done this work since she was a child and it is what she likes to do. She has an excellent ability to sell her products to buyers in Lima. This way, she is able to ensure that her products are sold wholesale without running the risk of them spoiling. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual in paying her monthly quotas. "La Libertad de Huaripampa" is the name of her communal bank. Upon receiving this loan, she will be able to buy two bags of pea seeds in order to start sowing. She will spend approximately 1100 soles.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio de 30 años de edad, está casada con Felipe,  con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 5 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el anexo de Huaripampa, en el distrito de Palca, provincia de Tarma. Rocio se dedica ala agricultura desde que era una niña. A sus 30 años, ahora cultiva para mantener a su familia. En el anexo de Huaripampa las tierras son propicias para la siembra de arvejas y papas. Ella posee terrenos propios donde siembra éstos productos. “Cada año siembro 2 veces las arvejas, y si me va bien”, comenta. Su esposo es el que más se esfuerza en el trabajo del campo. Todos los días, Felipe se levanta en la madrugada para limpiar y cuidar sus plantas. Sus cultivos de papas se ubican a 30 minutos de su localidad, y las jornadas de trabajo y traslado de sus productos son cansados. 
Rocio es una mujer fuerte y persistente, con estas características puede afrontar cualquier eventualidad en el campo. De esa manera puede educar a sus 3 hijos, quienes son su mayor razón para seguir trabajando. Rocio piensa sembrar 1 bolsa de semillas más arvejas para esta temporada, que equivale a 40 sacos en la cosecha. Esta sería el préstamo número 13 que obtendría de MFP. En los ciclos anteriores mostró puntualidad en los pagos, y ahora también piensa serlo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La Libertad de Huriapampa” y se siente satisfecha con el trabajo desplegado entre las socias.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas para ampliar su producción.
texts.en:
Rocio, age 30, is married to Felipe. They have three children ages 10, 7, and 5 and live in their own home in the Huaripampa annex, Palca district, Tarma province. Rocio has worked in agriculture since she was a child. Now that she is 30, she farms in order to support her family. The land in Huaripampa is favourable for sowing peas and potatoes. She has her own land where she sows these products. "Every year I plant peas twice, and it goes well for me," she says. Her husband is the one who works the hardest in the fields. Every day, Felipe gets up at dawn to clear weeds and care for his plants. Their potato plantation is 30 minutes away from where they live; the long days of working and transporting the products are tiring.
Rocio is a strong, resolute woman. These qualities allow her to confront any and every situation in the fields. She has been able to provide an education for their three children, who are the main reason she keeps working. Rocio plans to sow one more bag of pea seeds this season; this will mean 40 bags harvested. This will be her thirteenth loan with MFP. In the previous loan cycles, she demonstrated her punctuality with repayments; she plans to continue to be punctual. She belongs to the "La Libertad de Huriapampa" communal bank, and is happy with the way the work is distributed among the group members.
With this loan, she will be able to buy one bag of pea seeds to expand their production.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: El Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther  es conviviente,  tiene 30  años de edad y tiene 2 hijas, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “El Roció del Amanecer” grupo  conformado por 12  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Esther  se dedica a la venta de plásticos este negocio está situado en su casa tambien vende a provincia, a su vez trabaja de mesera en un club los fines de semana . Esther  empezó este negocio con la idea de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijas van a la escuela privada  , se ha comprado una computadora y a invertido en acabados para su casa, Esther  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar plasticos y venderlos a provincia ya que cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Esther  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.

Nota
La señora Laura es aquella que aparece en la parte superior de la foto con polo rosado y casaca.
texts.en:
Esther, 30, lives with a partner, and has 2 daughters.  She is now a member of the communal bank “El Roció del Amanecer."  This group has 12 members who have a variety of businesses.  Esther works selling plastic products.  Her business is located in her home, and she also sells in the province.  In addition, she works as a waitress in a club during the weekends.  Esther started this business with the idea of providing her family with a better quality of life.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to improve her income so that her daughters can go to a private school.  She has also been able to buy a computer and invest in some finishing touches for her home.  Esther is requesting a new loan to buy plastic products to sell in the province, because she has some regular customers.  Esther will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort, and the loans from Edaprospo will help her to do this.

Note:  Laura is the one who appears at the top of the photo with the pink shirt and jacket.

loans.use: to buy plastic merchandise to sell in the province

loans.name: Mahulomin Group

texts.fr: MAHULOMIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Delphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Delphine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Vincent.  Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors des cinq enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge.  Delphine  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Delphine n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Delphine vend depuis huit ans, des conserves, des boissons et des vivres à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Delphine vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile.  Delphine  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle,  Delphine  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHULOMIN  un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit consenti a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MAHULOMIN is a group which consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  Delphine is the facilitator of the group and she is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 36 years old, married to a reseller named Vincent.  The couple has 5 children who all attend school and who are all their dependents.  Besides their own children, they have another child in their care.  Delphine lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Delphine never attended school.  In order to cope with her various expenses, Delphine has been selling canned food, drinks and other food products from her home.  She also sells firewood from home.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.  In order to strengthen her business and to better meet her customers' needs, Delphine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the MAHULOMIN group.  The first loan granted was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 39 years old. Her priority in life is to uplift her family out of poverty and provide further education to her children. She has been blessed with 4 children, all of whom are single. Presently, Yan works as a local farmer cultivating rice crops from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has her husband who helps manage the rice field.

Yan doesn’t own any vehicle for use yet, so she is taking out her first loan from HKL as well as Kiva to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy the family’s requirements. She’s very happy with the given loan because it’ll better her family and reduce some expenses on transportation fees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy the family’s requirements.

loans.name: Juntos Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia prepara pasteles muy ricos, años atrás decidió trabajar por su cuenta y ser independiente empezó ofreciendo sus pasteles de puerta en puerta, tiempo después se instalo en la puerta de un colegio así de a pocos se fue ganando la confianza tanto de los niños que le compraban diariamente como de  los directivos del colegio quienes le ofrecieron  la concesión del kiosco para vender dentro del mismo, ya son 15 años que trabaja en dicho establecimiento, por otro lado la Sra. Julia se preparo estudiando cursos de pastelería, con el fin de mejorar su negocio. Ahora está incursionando en brindar servicios de buffet y tortas para todo tipo de eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños,graduaciones, 15 años etc. El préstamo obtenido será de mucha ayuda para la compra de sus azafates y acrílicos para las tortas y demás insumos e ingredientes, en un futuro quiere  brindar un servicio más completo como alquiler de toldos, mesas y sillas. Todos los esfuerzos que hace en su trabajo es para brindarle a sus 02 hijos lo mejor tanto en estudios como una vida cómoda, en la actualidad Julia es la presidenta del grupo “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO” son 06 socias amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar.
 
 *La Sra. Julia es la tercera de las paradas viste blusa rosada.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia makes delicious pastries. Several years ago, she decided to work for herself and be independent. She started selling her pastries door-to-door. Some time later, she started selling at the entrance of a school. Bit by bit, she won over the children so that they and the school officials buy daily. She was offered a kiosk in order to sell her pastries there. She has worked there for 15 years.
Julia is studying baking with the goal of improving her business. She is now starting to sell other food and pies for all kinds of events; weddings, birthdays, graduations, quinceaneras, etc. This loan will be of great help to her; she will be able to buy trays and containers for her pastries, as well as other supplies and ingredients. In the future she wants to offer a more complete service, such as renting marquees, tables, and chairs. She does all of this hard work in order to provide her two children with the best: education and a comfortable life.
Julia is currently the president of the "Juntos al Triunfo" group. This group has six members who are friends and neighbours.
*Sra. Julia is the third woman standing wearing the pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy trays and containers for her pastries.

loans.name: Katherine Lizbeth

texts.es:
Katherine tiene 21 años, vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo. Katherine es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño de 1 añito y junto a el vive en casa de su madre, la cual le ha brindado su apoyo incondicional y quien la apoya mucho cuidando a su bebe cuando ella se encuentra trabajando.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado tener su negocio de decoración para fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, quinceañeros entre otros desde hace 2 años, es muy detallista y sobre puntual en la entrega de sus decoraciones, ella recibe el apoyo de sus hermanos, quienes le brindan una mano cuando ella tiene mucho trabajo, para ella es muy importante realizar una buena labor por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hace todo lo posible para que su trabajo sea el mejor y así sus clientes la puedan recomendar y pueda tener más trabajo.

Katherine está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más telas de colores diversos para realizar su trabajo, esta mejora le permitirá mejorar sus decoraciones y con ello aumentaran sus ingresos y asi seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Katherine is 21 years old. She lives in the city of Imperial, a city characterized by the significant commercial activity of its inhabitants. In the surrounding area is the Ungará fortress, the last vestige of the Huarco culture and old Cañete. There are also old haciendas located among the extensive areas of cultivation.  Katherine is a single mother. She has a little one who is a year old. Together with him, she lives in the house of her mother, who has given her her unconditional support, and who helps her a lot by taking care of her baby when Katherine is working.

With much effort, she has succeeded for two years in having her business of decorations for children's parties, weddings, quinceañeros, and other events. She is very detail-oriented and hyper-punctual in the delivery of her decorations. She has the support of her brothers, who give her a hand when she has a lot of work. For her, it's very important to do a good job. For that reason, she believes that she is doing well in her business because she does everything possible so that her work will be the best. In this way, her clients can recommend her and she can have more work.

Katherine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more cloth of various colors in order to carry out her work. This improvement will allow her to improve her decorations, and with it her income will increase. In this way she will continue fighting to be able to realize her great dream: to give her child a profession and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Marie  est mariée à un cambiste du  nom de Abraham. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie a un autre enfant à sa charge, en dehors de ses enfants.  Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Marie  a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie  prépare des  repas (riz, pâte, etc.) qu’elle vend dans son quartier depuis quatre ans environs. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, Marie  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  GBENONKPO,  un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été déjà remboursés.
texts.en: The GBENONKPO group consists of four women who live in the same neighborhood.  Marie, 47, is the facilitator of the group and she is raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a money dealer named Abraham.  The couple has seven children, all in school, and all their dependents.  Besides her own children, Marie has another child in her care.  Marie lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Marie left school at the elementary level.  To cope with her various expenses, and for about four years now, she has been preparing meals (rice, pasta etc.) that she sells in her neighborhood.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  In order to increase her activity level and to attract more customers, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO group.  Previous loans have already been repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products and condiments.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en: To increase the busines and the population of pigs, Ni Ketut and the members of Tunjung Wiguna group continue to borrow loans. Ni Ketut will use the loan in this period to purchase local pigs for pigroll. This kind of pig is kept for two months and then are ready to sell. With this type of pig, she hopes to earn a higher profit. One of the members, Ni Putu, couldn't attend the meeting because she was attending a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: To purchase local pigs

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Rodita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store and buying and selling of fermented shrimps. Rodita is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Massan est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Massan vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Massan n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Massan vend depuis près de cinq ans, des vêtements de façon ambulante. Massan  achète ses produits dans un marché du  Bénin. En vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Massan sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le premier crédit dont Massan avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Massan is 30 years old, and is married to Albert. The couple has two children, both of whom go to school and are in their care. Besides their own children, the couple is responsible for one other child. Massan lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple meets the various household expenses. 

Massan did not go to school. To meet her needs and those of her family, she has been selling clothes on foot for almost  five years. Massan buys her merchandise in a market in Benin. With the goal of increasing her level of activity and to better meet customer demand, she is asking for financial support from ALIDé for the second time. Her first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas está formado por 11 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la parroquia del Valle llamada también como “San Bautista de El Valle”, está situada al sureste de Cuenca,  tiene  muchos lugares para visitar como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras). Esta parroquia es famosa por su producción de maíz, gran parte de su territorio está dedicado a los cultivo de ciclo corto  como maíz, fréjol y papas. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.  Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son muy amables y gentiles como nuestras socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar en adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Hilda, tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 8, 4 y 3 años y su ultimo hijo es un bebé de 8 meses de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Hilda pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en casa ya que sus hijos aun se encuentran pequeños, allí se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra pollos para continuar con esta actividad.
 
Su meta es trabajar en una fábrica de costura.
texts.en:
The Las Minas communal bank is composed of 11 women and 1 man. They live in the Del Valle parish, also called "San Bautista de El Valle". It is located to the southeast of Cuenca. It has many places to visit, such as the lake of Cochapamba (full of totora [a species of bulrush]). This parish is famous for its corn production. A large part of its territory is dedicated to short-cycle crops such as corn, beans, and potatoes. Its people dedicate themselves to business, raising animals, and agriculture, and many work in the city in various activities. Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their communities. They are very pleasant and kind, like the members of our communal bank, who work in various activities that permit them to cover their household expenses and move their families forward.

One of the members of this group is Hilda. She is 26 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has 4 children. Her last child is a baby who is 8 months old, and the others are 3, 4, and 8 years old. Her oldest son is studying in a little school in the town. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own property.

Hilda spends most of her time at home, since her children are still young. There she farms, and what she harvests is for the consumption of the household. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. 

This is her fifth loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy chickens in order to continue with this activity.

Her goal is to work in a dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Guztavo Leon

texts.es:
Gustavo es un joven soltero, tiene una hija y tiene deseos de contraer matrimonio con la madre de su hija para que ella pueda crecer en un hogar estable, actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres, sin embargo nos cuenta que desea  llevarlas a vivir a un lugar cómodo como ser un pequeño departamento.
 La actividad del cliente es armar cajas de juegos de magia, que a su vez son juegos didácticos, compra CD desde el desaguadero para lo cual viaja una vez al mes, trabaja con una imprenta que elabora las cajas y hace la impresión de las mismas. 
El y sus hermanos realizan el armado de las cajas donde incluyen el material para los juegos. Actualmente Gustavo viaja al interior País para incursionar este producto, que tuvo gran aceptación y demanda por lo innovador que resulta tener un juego de magia que a su vez es entretenimiento y destreza mental, El considera que esta actividad es nueva y no tiene hay mucha      competencia. El destino del crédito es para el capital de operación es decir compra de material para el armado de las cajas.
Entre sus metas  ampliar el negocio produciendo otro material para niños más pequeños.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a young single man with a daughter. He would like to marry the mother of his child so that she can grow up in a stable home, but at the moment he is living with his parents. He tells us that he would like to take his parents to live in a more comfortable home such as a small apartment. 

Gustavo assembles magic boxes which are comprised of educational games. He buys the CD for the game directly from the distributor, which is why he travels once a month. He works with a printer who makes and prints the boxes, then he and his siblings assemble the boxes, including the materials for the games. At the moment Gustavo is travelling to the centre of the country to try and enter his product into the market. So far it has been widely accepted and in high demand because of the innovativeness that comes from being a magic game that is both entertaining and mentally stimulating. He believes that this is a new product that does not have much competition. 

Gustavo will use this loan for working capital which will allow him to buy the supplies required to assemble the magic boxes. One of his goals is to increase his business by producing other material for younger children.

loans.use: to increase his working capital to purchase supplies he can use to assemble magic boxes

loans.name: Nonvitcha Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVITCHA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la septième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans et est une veuve. Jeanne a onze enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, six sont encore à la charge de Jeanne. Pour contribuer  aux besoins de sa famille, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis plus de trente ans, la vente du charbon de bois et des crevettes à son domicile, mais aussi dans un marché du Bénin. Jeanne s’approvisionne en crevettes sur les lacs du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group NONVITCHA is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Jeanne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Having the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, the members of this group are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the seventh time. 

Jeanne never attended school. She is 54 years old and a widow with eleven children, some of whom are in school. Among the children, six are still supported by her. To help meet the needs of the family, Jeanne has been running a business for over thirty years selling charcoal and shrimp out of her home but also at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies of shrimp from lakes in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Jeanne and the other members of the group NONVITCHA are requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and some shrimp

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Houssie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Houssie est mariée à un certain Innocent. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Houssie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Houssie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Houssie vend depuis plus de vingt ans, des condiments et du riz à son domicile. Houssie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Houssie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Missimide is a group made up of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Houssie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old. Houssie is married to a man named Innocent. The couple has five children, all of them in school and under their care. Aside from their children, the couple is responsible for another child. Houssie lives with her husband and her children. The couple sees to the various household expenses together. Houssie did not attend school.

In order to keep up with her various expenses, Houssie has been selling spices and rice from her home for more than 20 years. Houssie gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business in order to be more competitive in the market, Houssie, along with the other members of the Missimide Group, is seeking a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and spices.

loans.name: Owonikoko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OWONIKOKO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Kamariatou est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Kamariatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Kamariatou est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Chakirou. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Mais en plus de leur enfant, le couple a cinq autres enfants à leur charge. Kamariatou et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Kamariatou mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d'année, la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Kamariatou  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Kamariatou et les autres membres du groupe OWONIKOKO sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group OWONIKOKO is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Kamariatou, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Having the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, the members of this group are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the second time. 

Kamariatou never attended school. She is 50 years old and married to a driver by the name of Chakirou. They have one child who is in school and in their care. But in addition to their child, they have five other children to support. Kamariatou and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To help meet the needs of the family, Kamariatou has been running a business selling various goods (canned foods, soaps, cassava flour, etc.) out of her home for over twenty years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Kamariatou and the other members of the group OWONIKOKO are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned foods, soaps, and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Gbigbodote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBIGBODOTE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Dopevi Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Dopevi Sidonie est âgée de 39 ans et est  mariée à un certain Dossou. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dopevi Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Dopevi Sidonie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix ans que Dopevi Sidonie mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (« come » : aliment fait à base de maïs fermenté et de « ablo » : aliment fait à base du riz) dans son quartier. Dopevi Sidonie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Dopevi Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBIGBODOTE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The GBIGBODOTE group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  Dopevi Sidonie, age 39, and raising her hand in the photo, is the facilitator of the group. She is married to a man named Dossou.  The couple has four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Dopevi Sidonie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses together with her husband.  Dopevi Sidonie has never attended school.  For the past ten years, she has been selling food in her neighborhood ("come", a type of food made with fermented maize, and "ablo", made with rice).  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  She is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBIGBODOTE group, in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and rice, and condiments (onions).

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish and selling of coconut wine.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Thida

texts.en: Thida, 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for over five years earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who also earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve her business, Thida is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more ingredients for producing all kinds of food to sell to her clients. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients for producing all kinds of food to sell to her clients

loans.name: Cumbe Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades, las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, son personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido. Viven por la parroquia rural de Cumbe que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es de clima frió, en su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas y modernas construcciones conservando  parte de su arquitectura tradicional, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nataly, tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño de 5 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a laborar en un negocio propio, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Nataly hace 5 años traja con su esposo en su propio negocio, ellos tienen un centro de llamadas con cabinas telefónicas, internet y  venta de accesorios telefónicos, trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de accesorios, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas para su local.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Cumbe Centro Communal Bank is made up of six women and one man, members who work daily in various activities that allow them to pay for their household expenses.  They are kind people with warm hearts.  They live in the rural parish of Cumbe, which is to the south of the city of Cuenca and has a cold climate.  In the vicinity there are huge pastures of cattle ranches, haciendas, and modern constructions that preserve part of their traditional architecture.  The people there work raising animals, in agriculture, and in trade, and they preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is Nataly.  She is 23 years old and married, and has a five-year-old child from her marriage.  Her husband works in his own business.  The house in which she lives is her property.

For five years Nataly has worked with her husband in her own business.  They have a call center with telephone booths, Internet, and sales of telephone accessories.  They work from Sunday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night.

She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she is going to invest her new loan in buying accessories, phone card recharges, and phone cards for her business.

Her goal is to grow in her business.

The small attached photo is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy accessories, phone card recharges, and phone cards.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old, married and has 6 children. She has 5 children who are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been fattening pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to support her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un emprendedor dedicado a la comercialización de productos artesanales elaborados en hilo para tejer, acero, piedras, totumo, coco, semillas, etc. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en las afueras de un centro comercial al sur de la ciudad, sitio muy concurrido por personas en todas las horas del día y parte de la noche. Su clientela principal son personas jóvenes que transitan por el sector y clientes fijos que ha logrado conseguir con su calidez personal, por eso aunque  la competencia es alta,   se sostiene por buenos precios,   amabilidad en el servicio y también por  su ubicación en esa  zona de la ciudad, donde el mercado es muy  amplio y potencializa sus ventas, porque  alcanza para todos. Álvaro trabaja 12 horas diarias de lunes a domingo, en compañía de su cónyuge vendiendo de contado y comprando de la misma manera,  en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a diferentes proveedores de los centros comerciales. Como se encuentra afiliado a una asociación de vendedores del sur,  próximamente estará habitando la nueva galería otorgada por el gobierno local, pues será reubicado en u lugar muy cercano al  estadio Metropolitano, cuna del balompié de Colombia y esto a todos los comerciantes ambulantes los tiene muy felices. 
Alvaro goza de muy buenas referencia, porque cuida mucho sus relaciones y el buen comportamiento en su entorno. Sus estados financieros muestran una situación financiera estable con un inventario bien surtido de  productos artesanales, que ha logrado comprar a través de créditos costosos a personas informales y quiere gradualmente reemplazarlo,  para lograr     incrementar el capital de trabajo, pues  busca mantener un fondo en efectivo para comprar productos artesanales, al por mayor y de contado, con el objetivo de aumentar el inventario y el surtido, y aprovechar al máximo la temporada de pre carnaval y carnaval, para incrementar significativamente sus ventas .Esta es justamente a razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará bisutería, camisetas, calzado, artesanías carnavaleras, para responder apropiadamente a su demanda actual.
texts.en:
Alvaro is an enterpriser who is dedicated to selling handmade products decorated with weaving thread, steel, stone, gourds, coconut, seeds, etc.  His business is located in the outskirts of a mall at the south of the city, a site that is busy with people at all hours of the day and part of the night.  His main clientele are young people that pass through the area and regular customers that he has managed to obtain with his personal warmth.  This is why, even though the competition is great, he maintains his good prices.  Kindness in service and also because of his location in this area of the city, where the market is very large and he improves his sales, because he reaches for them all.  Álvaro works 12 hours every day of the week along with his spouse selling and buying items for cash in downtown Barranquilla, to different suppliers from the malls.  Since he is affiliated with an association of sellers from the south, he will soon be moving into the new gallery established by the local government.  It will be located in a place that is very close to the Metropolitan stadium, birthplace of the Colombian soccer player and this makes all of the traveling merchants very happy.

Alvaro enjoys very good references, because he cares a lot for his relationships and the good performance in his environment.  His financial state shows a stable situation with a well-assorted inventory of handicraft items which he has bought through costly loans from informal people.  He wants to gradually replace it, in order to increase his working capital.  He hopes to maintain a foundation of cash to buy handicraft products at wholesale and with cash, with the objective of increasing his inventory and the assortment, and make the most of the pre-carnival and carnival season, in order to significantly increase his sales.  This is precisely the reason for which he has requested the Kiva loan, with which he will buy costume jewelry, t-shirts, footwear, and carnival handicrafts to respond appropriately to his current demand.

loans.use: buy costume jewelry, t-shirts, shoes, and carnival handicrafts

loans.name: Santos Vidal

texts.es: Santos Vidal tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus hijos los cuales son todo para ella. La señora Santos se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulante. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para sacar adelante a su familia y poder  brindarle día a día las mejores condiciones y poder dar  el estudio a sus hijos con el fin de mejorarles su futuro y dejarles una buena herramienta con la cual se puedan defender en la vida. La señora Santos es una mujer increíble dado que se caracteriza por ser muy dedicada, responsable y trabajadora. Cuenta con algunos clientes fijos que la prefieren por la variedad, calidad y buenos precios en los productos que ofrece. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su humilde negocio en la compra de variedad de medicina natural, principalmente vitaminas para el cerebro que es lo que más le demandan. De esta forma confía en Dios todo poderoso que logrará mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos que la llevarán a lograr el sueño de su vida.
texts.en: Santos Vidal is 45 years old and she lives in a house with her children, who are everything to her. She works selling natural medicine, and she sells her products door to door. With a lot of hard work and dedication she has been able to maintain her business which is her main source of income. She works hard to benefit her family and to offer them a better lifestyle. She wants to provide her children with an education to improve their futures and give them the tools they need to succeed in life. Santos is an incredible woman who is known for being dedicated, responsible, and hardworking. She has some faithful clients that buy from her for the variety, quality, and good prices she offers. She applied for a loan to invest in her humble business and buy natural medicine like vitamins for the brain, which are in high demand. She believes that with the help of God she will be able to improve her sales and thus reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Para comprar: medicina natural, principalmente vitaminas para el cerebro.

loans.name: Choan

texts.en:
Choan, age 46, is a humble farmer living in Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She has a life partnership with her husband who dedicates his time to animal trading around the province. She now has 5 children. One among them has started a new family and lives independently. 
At this time, Choan would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for the household's use. Moreover, this motorcycle will enable her husband to go further to distant areas to trade his animals. In the future, Choan hopes that she’ll be able to continually provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the household's use.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut continues to borrow loans from MUK. This loan is being used to purchase two sows. She has a plan to be a piglet seller. The piglets are kept only two months and then sold. It reduces the cost of feed from what it would be if she keeps pigs for fattening. She hopes this plan will run well. She already made her promotion to other members and her neighbor. With this business, she dreams of buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase two sows

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por 12 socias, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay que es conocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador",  es la ciudad cultural del país ya  que fue nombrada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen las tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son trabajadoras, luchadoras y diariamente con sus labores aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir adelante.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Albertina, tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo no se encuentra en la ciudad ya que ha viajado al extranjero para mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Albertina labora en un taller de bordado, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio tiempo y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cría de estos animales para tener un negocio propio.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique.

La foto pequeña adjunta ees de una socias que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" [Decisive Women] is made up of 12 members who live in different parts of Cuenca, capital of the province of Azuay, which is known as the "Athens of Ecuador". Cuenca is known as a cultural city of the country since it was designated as a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site in December of 1999. Its people are polite, kind and preserve their village traditions. Our members are hard workers, persistent, and through their labor they provide financially to support their homes.
 
Albertina is one of the group members. She is 42 years old, married, and had 2 children of 21 and 17 years of age. Her first son works and helps her financially. Her second son is a college student in the city. Her husband is not in the city since he has gone overseas to bring them a better standard of living. The house in which they live belongs to Albertina.
 
She works in an embroidery workshop from Monday to Friday part-time and spends the rest of her time as a housewife. 

This is her first loan with the communal bank to which she was invited by a friend. The loan will be used to buy poultry to raise them and start her own business. Her goal is to one day own a boutique. 

The small picture attached is one of the associates who was unable to be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
The Kerta Jaya Amerta group received another loan from MUK for Rp 15,000,000 for the 10 members and each member gets Rp 1,500,000. These loans are used to support the efforts of raising pigs.

Ni Nengah is using this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp 400,000/piglet. The remainder of the loan is being used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Nengah is feeding with traditional feed made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.

Ni Nengah is pursuing this effort to support the family economy, particularly to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old, married, and a mother of four. She is living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she works producing corn. She's been in this business for five years, and she normally earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, to increase her production. When her crop is harvested, Josephine will use the revenue to expand her business so that she can earn more income and sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: María Ercilia

texts.es: María Ercilia de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad con sus dos hijos de 5 y 13 años los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace ya varios años. Dicho negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación en el cual cuenta con un espacio adecuado para la colocación de sus productos de manera atractiva para los clientes. Dado a que es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y carismática muchas personas la prefieren y cada día tiene más clientes que demandan sus productos.  Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su tiendita la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder dar  a sus hijos una calidad de vida diferente a la que ella ha tenido, esta es la razón por la cual trabaja duramente para logar su sueño y poder mejorar la situación en la que actualmente se encuentra. Ha estado pensando mucho en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio y ha llegado a la conclusión que sería benéfico  surtir su tienda de tal forma que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda al por mayor tales como: huevos, aceite, galletas, arroz, frijoles, churros, jabón, aceite, y de mas productos que logren atraer a más clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta forma logrará sacar a delante a su familia y logar su sueño.
texts.en:
María Ercilia, 42, lives in a house that is her own property with her two children, ages 5 and 13, who are studying.  She has worked in a store business for several years.  This business is located in her house, in which she has a suitable space to place her products attractively for her customers.  Given that she is a responsible, hardworking, and charismatic  woman, many people prefer her and every day she has more customers who request her products.  With effort and dedication she has managed to support her little store, which is her main source of income.

Her biggest dream is to be able to give her children a different quality of life than what she had.  This is why she works hard to achieve her dream and be able to improve the situation in which she currently finds herself.  She has been thinking a lot about the way to make her business grow and she has come to the conclusion that it would be beneficial to stock her store in such a way as to be able to cover greater demand.

For this reason she has made the decision to request this loan of INTEGRAL to invest in buying store products wholesale, such as eggs, oil, cookies, rice, beans, "churros" [fried dough], soap, and other products that will attract more customers.

She trusts in Almighty God that in this way she will manage to get her family ahead and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, cookies, rice, beans, "churros" [fried dough], soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.
