She previously worked as a housekeeper in a hotel.  For over four years she has been making "dulce de leche" (a thick, creamy, caramel-like milk-based sauce or spread) in different forms and shapes.  She says that she started her business activity with financial resources from a loan.  She now develops her product with help from her husband, and she hires three people full time as much for production as for commercialization.

She has had loan experience, and she is now requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make the sweets.  She hopes to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make dulce de leche.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 29 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines.  Her husband, Jayson, is an electrician.  Kristine and Jayson have one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business.  Kristine works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Kristine sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct sales brands like Avon and others.  She purchases a customer’s order in cash and then gives a customer a one-month-to-pay credit.  Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and the profits are the dealer’s income.  Kristine’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every week.

Kristine requests a PHP 9,000 loan to help her continue her business operations.  She will be use the loan to buy merchandise and place orders for her customers.  Kristine expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Kristine fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products for her direct-sales business.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca Luz, tiene 38 años de edad, está soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos de 19, 24 y 25 años de edad, de los cuales dos ya están casados, vive en la aldea Carrizal de Taulabe, junto a su hijo menor.
Ella tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la fabricación de Cal, este producto es utilizado en las construcciones y también la utilizan en los hogares para cocinar el maíz.  Su proceso es comprar  la piedra y aserrín para quemarla y sacar la cal.
Este negocio es rentable y tiene gran demanda en tiempo de verano.
El préstamo que solicita a ODEF es para comprar materia prima como piedra y aserrín para la fabricación de Cal para la venta.
Con las ganancias obtenidas va apoyar a sus hijos en cuanto tengan alguna necesidad.
texts.en:
Blanca Luz, age 38, is single because she was widowed.  She has three children, ages 19, 24, and 25.  Two of her children are married.  She lives with her youngest child in the village of Carrizal in Taulabe.

For approximately 25 years she has been making lime powder.  This product is used in construction, and it is also used in home to cook corn.  Her process is to buy the rock and sawdust, burn it, and take out the lime powder.

This business is profitable, and there is a great demand in the summer.

The loan she is requesting from ODEF is to buy raw materials like stone and sawdust in order to make the lime powder to sell.  She will use her earnings to support her children when they are in need.

loans.use: to buy stone and sawdust in order to produce lime powder.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, two of whom are working and the others are still studying. Fadel strives to work really hard in order to offer a respectable life for his family. 

He has been working as a truck mechanic since 1990 and has his own garage. He’s well known for his good work and good reputation as well. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed mechanical supplies for his garage in order to carry on his work in a proper way and nonstop without facing problems. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his garage.

loans.use: to purchase the needed mechanical supplies for his garage

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch is 41 years old. She has a common law relationship with her husband and has been blessed with 5 children: 4 are single and one is married. Her second child quit studying due to the family experiencing financial difficulties. Thus, she always helps Ouch in making bamboos baskets at home. 

With the requested amount from HKL and Kiva, Ouch will use the loan to buy wooden boards to replace some broken parts. After mending, Ouch hopes to provide her children with a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards to replace some broken parts.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. Since he’s the main income provider for his family, Imad is doing the best he can to satisfy their needs. He opened a furniture workshop in 2002 and already has 15 years of experience in this domain. He has his loyal customers and is looking forward to further expand his business. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added materials for his business such as wood, sponges, furniture paintings and many other items. This Kiva loan will increase his productivity, thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his business such as wood, sponges, furniture paintings and many other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.  For four years, she has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan.

Mary requests this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 45 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Lolito, a driver.  Isabel is the mother of six children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating their business.  Isabel works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Isabel operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in a piecemeal fashion to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo or one egg.  Isabel buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them as individual items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Isabel earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

Isabel is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue business operations.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Isabel hopes to be able to expand her business soon and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joesline

texts.en: Joesline is 35 years old and married with four children, all of them are still in school. She has a business of selling charcoal. Joesline is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
This is Cristeta, 47, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her only child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristeta retails biscuits and native sweets. What she basically does is buy biscuits and sweet snacks from wholesalers, then she repacks them and sells them per pack with a profit. Products can range from polvoron, regular biscuits and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristeta dreams to expand her business and help her child through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, age 52. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, in the Philippines. Her husband, Rogelio, is a driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating a recylcing business. At this time, Teresita is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines. While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They then sell these to junk shops for a profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories. 

Teresita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Teresita is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the money to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresita hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy scrap materials needed in her recycling business.

loans.name: Iakob

texts.en:
Iakob lives in the village of Ikalto, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Pati, and 20-year-old daughter and 19-year-old son. Iakob works as a night-watch in a local school. His son works in a local Security Service Company and his daughter is a student. Total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Iakob used to run a pig farm and cultivate family-owned land, but 5 years ago he sold all his pigs in order to get funds for his children's education. Now he has applied for business start-up credit in the frames of the Kiva Start-up program. He will use the requested credit for purchasing pigs and cultivation of the land, where he will sow vegetables. Iakob will sell harvested vegetables, as well as piglets on the local market. 

The income of the family will significantly increase. They will be able to purchase additional household goods, in order to improve family members’ living conditions. Also, Iakob plans to reinvest part of the received income in further development of the pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pay for land cultivation

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is a 48-year-old farmer from the village of Sartichala in East Georgia. He lives with his family: wife Naile and 19-year-old son. His son is temporarily unemployed.  

Nodar and Naile run a small dairy farm, which is the only source of income for the family. There are two milk cows on the farm.  Naile produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product in the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 300 Laris. 

Nodar requested credit to expand their dairy farm.  He will purchase a milk cow. With three milk cows, the family will be able to increase the production and sales of cheese by 50%. Their monthly income will grow by 150 Laris.  With the increased income, Nodar plans to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en:
Guguli is a 59-year-old farmer from the village Geguti, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband – Amiran, 33-year-old son, and two grandsons (6 and 4 years old). The family has 2 milk cows. They produce dairy products, part of which is consumed by the family and the surplus is sold in the local market. According to Credo's estimations, Guguli’s family belongs to the subsistent poor. Guguli has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the local government. 

Guguli requested credit to start up a new business. She will purchase construction materials and hire workers to construct a greenhouse with an area of 500 sq meters. She will grow greens and tomatoes in the greenhouse.  The harvested products will be sold to local greengrocery retailers. This initiative will significantly increase her family’s income and they will be able to combat poverty and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: build a greenhouse

loans.name: Bahja Group

texts.en:
This group is called BAHJA and consists of four members: Bahja, Fwziah, Najmah and Sabrin. They live in Aden, Yemen and they are in their 19th loan cycle. By working together they have been able to help each other and thus be able to improve their quality of life.They requested a loan of 200,000 YER.

Bahja is the group leader. She is 38 and a married woman and has eight children.  Her group is called by her name. (She is standing in the centre  holding a white handbag.) She works selling clothes and has been operating her business for seven years.

She started out in business selling small quantities of clothing from her home. She worked hard and gradually increased her sales. She now sells her products in the public market. She is a dynamic and hard-working woman, always putting forth the maximum effort in order to be able to give her family everything they need so they do not lack for any type of necessity.

Bahja went to AMB to ask for a loan of 50,000 YER in order to buy buy additional stock of clothes such as dresses, fabrics, and other items. She would like her children to study so that they can enjoy a better future. And she also wants to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothes such as dresses, fabrics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mahoukpehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPEHOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Faustin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Faustin est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Faustin a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Faustin est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Albertine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Faustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges, Faustin vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des chemises dans une ville du Bénin De façon secondaire, Faustin vend des tissus. Faustin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Faustin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKPEHOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUKPEHOU consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. They are seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to bolster their activity. The group’s representative is Faustin, whose hand is raised in the photo. Faustin is 49 years old and he lives in Benin. He attended secondary school. He is married to a reseller named Albertine. The couple have four dependent children who all go to school. The whole family live together, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

In order to provide for his family, Faustin started selling shirts in a city of Benin about ten years ago. He also sells fabrics as a secondary activity. Faustin buys his stock in a market of Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase his sales and revenue, Faustin is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the MAHOUKPEHOU group. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buys shirts and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 25-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are still in school.  For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan.

Joice is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa, 30, is a seamstress in a private tailoring company. She has been working since last year. She is unmarried and lives with her retired parents and her two kids in the slum district of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They own an old house which was built early in the 1970s. The walls, roof, and floor need to be insulated and the plumbing system needs to be replaced. 

After renovation the house should be well insulated from the cold weather and coal usage and emission of smoke will be much reduced. At the same time it will reduce air pollution around the city. Therefore a loan will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary building materials such as bricks, pipes, wood planks, paints and some insulation materials for her old house renovation.

loans.use: To purchase necessary building materials such as bricks, pipes, wood planks, paint and some insulation materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are still in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for three years.

Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy 10 baskets of potatoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 41, is a humble resident from Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she permanently lives together with her husband and three school-aged kids. She earns a living by selling fresh fish from a rented booth in a local market. Her husband supports her efforts.

Eng plans to rebuild her house made of wood with her saving in the coming months. She has bought some construction materials already. And now she would like to receive some funds from HKL to supplement her capital to start constructing this house. Eng hopes to a have a comfortable house in the coming months.

loans.use: to supplement her capital to start constructing a house.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s the one taking care of his family and seeking to offer them a suitable life. 

In 1990, Ali opened his own restaurant. He’s specialized in cooking and selling chicken. People visit him from all the neighbor areas because of his delightful and delicious food. Today, he needs to take out a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an ice cream machine for his restaurant. This product-diversification will allow him to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to enlarge his restaurant and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine for his restaurant

loans.name: Taivanjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Taivanjargal, 36, is a taxi driver and has been running his business for six continuous years. He lives with his old father, his wife and his daughter in his father’s old house, which is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daily income usually does not meet his family's expenses.
 
Taivanjargal wants to renovate his old house, which was built in the early 1960s. It is broken and has been becoming old for years, especially its most core parts such as the roof, walls, floor and the wall insulation, which became bad and was removed. Therefore, he deiced to take a loan to purchase some building materials to renovate his old house. He thinks that after renovation, the house should become well-insulated from the cold weather, and coal usage and emission of smoke will be much reduced; then, it will reduce air pollution around the city, too.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
This is Normita, age 55, who is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, in the Philippines. She is married to Gaspar, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Normita manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Normita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Normita is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Normita dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for her food stall business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are still in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Jean

texts.en:
This is Veronica, 49, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leopoldo, a driver, and the mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Veronica operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells personal products for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Veronica hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school fees

loans.name: Lubomir

texts.ru:
Любомир с супругой и дочерью живет в селе Гладковка. Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в тепличных условиях на продажу. На 1 гектаре земли он выращивает 8 000 кустов помидор, 2 000 кустов огурцов 10 тонн картофеля ежегодно. Фермерством занимается уже на протяжении 4 лет. Оборотный капитал составляет 90 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет около 5 100 гривен.  

Любомиру необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена на 6 000 гривен, удобрения на 5 000 гривен, дрова на 3 000 гривен и пленку на 6 000 гривен. Дополнительные средства необходимы для того, чтобы вовремя привести в порядок теплицы и подготовиться к весеннему сезону как следует, чтобы получить хороший урожай. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Lubomir lives in the village of Gladkovka with his wife and daughter. In his greenhouses, he grows early-season vegetables for sale. On 1 hectare of land, he annually grows 8,000 tomato plants, 2,000 cucumber plants, and 10 tonnes of potatoes. Lubomir has been a farmer for four years. His woking capital totals 90,000 hryvnia, while his take-home profit is approximately 5,100 hryvnia.

Lubomir needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds for 6,000 hryvnia, fertilizer for 5,000 hryvnia, firewood for 3,000 hryvnia, and plastic film for 6,000 hryvnia. These additional funds are needed to perform timely maintenance on the greenhouses and to prepare properly for the spring season, so as to produce a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, firewood and plastic film

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is single and has two children. She owns a grocery shop that has been in operation for eight months. She started it off using her savings.

Margaret is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more grocery items e.g. flour, cereals, tomatoes, onions and charcoal. Her only challenge is some clients not paying on time. She looks forward to constructing a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more flour, cereals, tomatoes, onions and charcoal.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Cipriana; La socia tiene 56 años de edad; La socia es casada, La socia  tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la menudencia de cordero; en un local muy concurrido y conocido en la ciudad; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de menudencia de cordero al por mayor y hacer  la contrata para dentro de 7 dias le entregen otro grupo y asi para cubrir el mes. esto consiste en comprar riñoncitos, higado, viceras, corazon, huevos, patitas, cabeza de cordero.


La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Siempre Juntos" communal bank, located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is Cipriana. She is 56, married, and has three children. She sells lamb offal in a very busy and well-known shop in the city.  She wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of lamb offal at wholesale, and contract to have it delivered within seven days by another group, in order to cover the month. 

This involves buying lamb offal, such as kidneys, liver, entrails, heart, testicles, feet, and head.

Cipriana is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, which will allow her to invest in her business and improve her financial position.

loans.use: To buy lamb offal.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and one child. After finding it hard to cover his family expenses he decided to double his effort and try his best to satisfy their needs. He started his own work as a painter in 2006, on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well-organized work. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to a buy new painting tools and thus improve his business.  This Kiva loan will allow him to start his new projects properly and as they should be. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to buy new painting tools and improve his business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and three children, one of whom is working while two others are still attending school. With his son’s cooperation, Hasan is able to cover his family expenses and pay his children’s educational fees. 

He has been working at repairing tailoring machines since 2004 and has his own shop. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added tools for his business as well as a tailoring machine. He notes that this loan will improve his work and therefore his revenues. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: to buy added tools for his business as well as a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Азимджону 32 года, живет с родителями. Его отец частный предприниматель, а мать пенсионерка. Он арендует магазин и торгует там  дисками. Он торгует там почти 3 года. Раньше был просто продавцом, теперь он сам хозяин и  заказывает диски для записи кинофильмов и  различных концертов.
texts.en: Azimjon is 32 years old and lives with his parents.  His father is an honest entrepreneur, and mother is a retiree.  Azimjon leases a store and sells discs there.  He has been selling there for almost three years.  Previously, he was just a salesperson and now the owner, and orders discs for recording movies and various concerts.

loans.use: to purchase DVD discs

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ibrohim lives in Shahrituz. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. His wife works on a farm and he has a livestock-raising business. He has been in business for 10 years. Ibrohim will use his loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jumamurod

texts.ru: Жумамурод проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе с женой занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает запчасти автомобилей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. В этой области он четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа бычка и покупки необходимых запчастей.
texts.en: Jumamurod lives in Qubadiyon. He is 58, married, and has three children. He and his wife are in retail. He has a store where he sells spare parts for cars, which he has been doing for 10 years. Jumamurod has also been raising livestock for four years. He is taking out a loan to purchase a calf and to buy some needed spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and spare parts

loans.name: Lal

texts.ru: Лаъл проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится на заработках за границей. Сама она занимается животноводством. Она закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Lal lives in Qubadiyon. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is working outside the country. She raises animals on her own, buying livestock to re-sell in the future. Lal is taking out a loan to purchase calves with the goal of increasing the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается одиннадцать лет. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en: Safarali is engaged in cattle breeding. He has a corral outside of his house. Safarali has been engaged in this activity for eleven years. He is 38 years old, married, and has six children. Safarali is taking out a loan to purchase young bulls and calves.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls and calves

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Natif de Mopti, Hamidou a 42 ans marié à une femme et père de 4 enfants, il vit dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Dû à des raisons familiales, Hamidou n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier.  Après quelques temps en aventure, Hamidou revient au pays et commencé les activités de gardiennage. C’est  avec ces revenus, qu’il a pris l’initiative de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus, aujourd’hui il est vendeur de boissons dans un centre culturel de Koutiala, depuis 5 ans.  L’ activité qu’il mène est très rentable, car il vend beaucoup de boissons par jour. 
Pour pouvoir renforcer son fonds de commerce, Hamidou chercha une collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.  Il est à son quatrième  prêts individuel et les trois précédents ont été bien payés. Hamidou compte acheter,  30 casiers de boissons auprès des grossistes qu’il vendra au centre culturel de Koutiala à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant. 
Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, il compte sur un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, prendre les charges  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Mopti, Hamidou is 42 years old, married and father of 4 children, he lives in Koutiala (Sikasso region).
For family reasons, Hamidou was not able to study. After seeking his fortune for a while, Hamidou came back to his homeland and started working as a caretaker.With the proceeds from this work he took the initiative of looking into profit making activities. He has now been a beverages salesman in a cultural centre in Koutiala for 5 years. His business pays well for he sells many beverages every day.
To increase his turnover, Hamidou started collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution 3 years ago. This is his fourth individual loan and the three previous loans were repaid correctly.Hamidou intends to purchase 30 crates of beverages from the wholesalers which he will then sell at the cultural centre in Koutiala for cash to a clientele made up of men and women.
With the expansion of his business, he expects a profit of 90.000FCFA per month which he will use for the reimbursement of his loan from Soro Yiriwaso, expenses for his family and the remainder he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: purchase alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Hanane

texts.en:
Hanane is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and two school-aged children. She collaborates with her husband to enrich their life and to live as it should be. Her husband has been working a local company for seventeen years. As for her, she has been working in selling traditional clothes from her home since 2006. She also sells shoes and bags. 

Today, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a big quantity of traditional clothes as well as shoes in order to boost her sales and therefore increase her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own traditional clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a big quantity of traditional clothes as well as shoes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 58-year-old Lebanese divorced man living with his four working children. He’s the one taking care of his family and trying to offer them a fair way of living. He has been working at renting apartments on a free-lance basis for the past twelve years. He’s expert in his job and well known from his customers. 

Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on some of his apartments. In that way, he will guarantee the safety of his clients and demonstrate that he’s delivering quality as well. In the future, he plans to develop his job and buy additional apartments.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on some of his apartments.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 28 years old and the mother of two young kids. She is a resident of the Prey Chor district, where she cultivates rice for a livelihood, and her spouse is a construction laborer.

Run is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle, because presently her family doesn’t own a suitable vehicle to travel to distant areas. She hopes that her living conditions will improve through using the loan from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 28 year old married man.  He has a son who is 2 years old.  He describes himself to be a respectful, wise and focused man. 

He operates a general stall where he sells items such as basins, cooking pots, thermos flasks, bowls, plates, buckets, belts, etc.  He has been involved in this business for 8 years.  His business is located at in urban area and his primary customers are repeat ones and passersby.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy seasons because the area isn't accessible as the place of operation is in the open air.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more basins, cooking pots, thermos flasks and water glasses.  His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more basins, cooking pots, flasks and glasses.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man.  He has 2 children, ranging in age from 3 to 9 years old.  He describes himself to be an aggressive man.  

He operates a carpentry shop where he sells furniture.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase timber.  His business goal is to run a well stocked carpentry shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase timber.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and she supports her mother.  She is in the business of brick making, a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy firewood which will be used to fire the bricks and pay laborers.  The anticipated profit will help her repay her loan.  Her dream is to have a wholesale brick supply business.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy firewood and pay labourers.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is a 38 year old married woman with four children, all of them are still in school.  She has a business selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for two yeas.

Rejoice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором  1969 года рождения, она одна воспитывает 3 детей. У нее есть ларек, где она торгует едой быстрого приготовления. В основном ее клиенты это студенты и школьники, они покупают у нее бутерброды и хотдоги. С прошлого кредита она покупала микроволновую печь, чтобы греть еду в своем ларьке для улучшения условий кафе. Настоящий кредит использует для ремонта своей квартиры.
texts.en: Dilorom was born in 1969 and is raising three children by herself.  She has a kiosk, where she sells fast food.  Her customers are mainly college and school students, who buy sandwiches and hot dogs from her.  Dilorom used her last loan to buy a microwave oven in order to heat up food in her kiosk and improve cafe conditions.  She is requesting this loan to repair her apartment.

loans.use: to repair her apartment

loans.name: Tuhtaboi

texts.ru: Тухтабою 42 года,  женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозяйка. В свободное время, делает ремонт квартир и других помещений. Дома он содержит скот, за скотом ухаживает жена и дети. Опыт в бизнесе более 20 лет. Сотрудничать с нашей организации начал в 2010 году. Кредит получил для  увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Tuhtaboi is 42 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  In his free time, he repairs apartments and other spaces.  Tuhtaboi keeps livestock at home, and his wife and children take care of it.  He has 20 years of experience in this business.  He started working with our organization in 2010.  Tuhtaboi is obtaining this loan to increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio David; El socio tiene 28 años de edad; el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio tiene un galpon que es un espacio especial para criar cuyes, el socio a aprendido todo sobre la crianza, alimentacion, reproduccion, gestacion de estos animales, el socio esta ampliando poco a poco su espacio y desea en esta ocasion invertir el prestamo en la compra de 200 cuyes para implementar su negocio.

El socio agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Juntos"; this bank is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, and Cusco Department.

The associate David is 28 years old. The associate is living with his partner and has one child. The associate raises guinea pigs for a living. He has a shed that is a special space for raising guinea pigs. The associate learned everything about raising, feeding, breeding, and managing these animals. He is gradually expanding his space and on this occasion wants to invest his loan in the purchase of 200 guinea pigs in order to help his business.

The associate is grateful that the loan opportunity will permit him to invest in the business and to grow economically.

loans.use: to purchase 200 guinea pigs to help his business.

loans.name: Ehrom

texts.ru: Эхром проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Эхром занимается выпечкой и торговлей национальных видов лепешек. Он в основном у себя дома печет лепешки и продет на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки.
texts.en: Ehrom lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Ehrom has secondary education. He bakes bread and sells various kinds of traditional Tajik flat bread. Ehrom bakes bread at home and sells it at the market. He owns a market stall. He has been engaged in this activity for eight years. Ehrom is requesting a loan to buy flour in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy flour to bake his own bread for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 44-year-old married man who has worked as a taxi driver for eight years. That's why he has to keep his car in good shape. Ali came back to Lebanon eight years ago. He used to work in car vehicle repairing, but hasn't done that for the last eight years. He is a father of three beloved children, and his car is his only source of making a living. His wife takes good care of his family.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to change his car's engine to keep it in good repair and ready for customers' requests all the time. This is his fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing pay back history. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his social situation, and he hopes to keep on improving his business in the future.

loans.use: To change his car's engine.

loans.name: Chort

texts.en:
Chort is 32 years old now. He works for his country as a soldier. He has a life partner in his wife who acts as a seamstress, providing sewing services to local people in their neighborhood. This couple is blessed with a lovely young kid.

Chort is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a stock of clothes to support his wife’s business. In the future, Chort and his wife want to own a seamstress shop, from which they can sell new as well as used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to support his wife’s business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 42 year old married woman.  She has 2 children, ranging in age from 3 to 9 years old.  She describes herself to be religious woman. 

She operates a general store where she sells charcoal, kale and bananas.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of charcoal.  She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase more charcoal for selling.  Her business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Bandar

texts.en:
Bandar is a 31-year-old married man.  In 2000 Bandar opened a Barber shop in Nabatieh.  His work is going on fine and most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.  This is his only source for income.  He has 16 years of experience in this business.  This long period of time earned him his customer's trust and support.

To keep his customers happy, Bandar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary decorations for his shop.  This will help his shop keep attracting customers.  This is Bandar's second loan as a Al Majmoua borrower.  He has a good standing with a good payment history.  He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can and to open a special facial treatment sector in the future, which is highly requested by his customers.

loans.use: To do necessary decorations for his shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30 year old businessman.  He is married to Rose who also contributes to the family income.  He has been running his butchery for about six months with a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and  he will use it to buy more sufurias (cooking pots) for boiling soup and also to fry meat for his customers in his butchery.  He hopes to grow his business and expand his business to be a supplier of meat.

loans.use: To buy bigger cooking pots (Sufurias).

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 38 year old married woman with four children, all of them are still in school.  She has a business of selling fish in Yei South Sudan for the past three years.

Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man.  He has a son who is 3 years old.  He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil etc.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years.  His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are the local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of home products sold. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, etc.  His business goal is to be  a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To restock his shop with sugar, salt, wheat flour etc.

loans.name: Holniso

texts.ru: Холнисо 49 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей.  Она нигде не работает. Ее муж работает охранником в дехканском хозяйстве. Поэтому он помогает ей разводить скот. Для покупки и продажи он помогает выводить скот  на рынок, а в остальном она ухаживает за скотом сама. Кредит получает с 2010 года, для увеличения поголовья скота. Ее старшие сыновья находятся в России и присылают им деньги. Она живет со своими невестками и внуками.  Невестки и внуки помогают по  хозяйству и в разведение скота. Она получила кредит для покупки скота.
texts.en: Holniso is 49 years old, married and has two children.  She is not employed anywhere.  Her husband works as a security guard at a dekhan farm.  This is why he helps Holniso to breed livestock.  He helps her to take livestock to a market for purchases and sales, and she takes care of the livestock herself.  Holniso has been obtaining loans since 2010 to increase livestock headcount.  Her older sons are in Russia and send money home.  She lives with her daughters-in-law and grandchildren, who help with the household and breeding livestock.  Holniso is obtaining this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
This is the second cycle loan of Som, age 45, who lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city, where local people prefer a rice farming business to other businesses. Som, as well as other villagers, is in the business of rice husbandry. From this business, she is able to earn only a low income because she just owns a small piece of land for her rice project. However, the main source of income is from her husband who provides his motor taxi service from dawn to dusk at the fields.

Som is now taking this loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase additional farmland, which will enable her family to improve their living standards and move out of poverty. She hopes she’ll be able to make a good harvest in the following seasons.

loans.use: to purchase additional farmland.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty nine year old married man with five children, living in Kasese,Uganda.  His personal goals are to educate his children, buy a car and save for the wedding.

He has been practicing agriculture for the last eleven years and his major hardships are price fluctuations, high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However he has a goal of buying land to grow more crops, expanding his farm to new areas and hiring employees to help expand his farm.  John needs a loan to buy coffee, maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: To buy coffee, maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 6 children, with ages ranging from 10 to 26 years. She describes herself to be a "go-getter woman." She operates a food stall where she sells cooked fish. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the food stall. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more fish. Neema's business goal is to be a wholesale fish seller within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Living

texts.en:
Living is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to buy land and build a family house. He has been in an electronics business for the last two years after starting with capital of one million UGX. His business is now worth three million.

His major hardships have been price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Despite these challenges, he has a goal of trading in wholesale. Living needs the loan to buy flat iron, radios and cables to sell.

loans.use: to buy flat iron, radios and cables to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has a son who is one year old. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at an environment conducive to the business and her primary customers are frequent.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of healthy chicks. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more chicks. Alice's dream and hope is to be a big farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Gershom

texts.en:
Gershom is a 50-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His personal goal is to educate his children and set up other income generating activities. He has been a farmer for the last four years and his major hardship is unpredictable seasonal changes; however, he has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his farm. 

Gershom needs a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en:
Fideri, a 31-year-old married father with three children, lives in Kasese, Uganda where he has been a farmer raising crops for the past 10 years. His major hardships are price fluctuations and seasonality, but he aspires to buy land to grow crops, expand his business to new areas, and hire employees to help expand his farming activities.

Now requesting a loan to plough, buy seeds and maintain his farm, Fideri's personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house, and buying a car.

loans.use: to plough, buy seeds and maintain his farm.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a 53-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. 

He has been in farming for the last ten years and his major hardships are inflation and seasonal weather. However, he has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his farming activities. Fabiano needs a loan to pay laborers, buy other farm inputs, and buy pesticides.

loans.use: to pay laborers, buy farm inputs, and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида торгует на рынке 2 года у нее есть свой небольшой магазин, где она продает детскую одежду. Она считает, что у нее выгодный товар. Дети быстро растут и покупателям всегда нужно обновлять одежду для своего ребенка. За товаром ездит сама 2 раза месяц. Ее муж торгует красками, у нее есть единственный сын, который помогает отцу в торговле. Саида получает у нас очередной кредит, первый кредит она получила 2 года назад, в этот раз у нее есть заказ уже на весенний детский товар.
texts.en: Saida has been selling at a market for two years and has a small store, where she sells children's clothing.  She thinks that she has profitable merchandise.  Children grow up fast, and customers always need to update clothing for their children.  Saida travels for merchandise by herself twice per month.  Her husband sells paint, and they have one son, who helps the father with the sales.  Saida is obtaining her next loan from us.  She received her first loan two years ago, and this time, she already has an order for children's spring goods.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of spring clothing

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас женщина 45 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей из , которых две дочки близняшке. Они обе выданы замуж, но как у нас принято родители невесток должны подарить им мебель для молодожён. Мукаддас решила в кредит купить в магазине спальный гарнитур, для чего подала заявку на кредит. Она сама в летний сезон шьёт национальные платья, а её муж на заработках в Р.Ф. Мукаддас очень пунктуальная женщина, которая раньше кредитовалась у нас два года назад и ей нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en: Mukaddas is a 45 year-old woman. She is married and has four children, two of them twin girls. Both girls have been married off, but as tradition dictates, the brides' parents must make a gift of furniture to the newlyweds. Mukaddas has decided to borrow money to buy a set of bedroom furniture, and so has requested this loan. She sews traditional dresses during the summer season, while her husband currently works in Russia. Mukaddas is a very punctual woman who already had a loan from MDO Arvand, LLC two years ago, and she is satisfied with the conditions of borrowing.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her newlywed daughters

loans.name: Zivayda

texts.ru:
Зивайда проживает в селе Бургонду на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Зивайда  откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Зивайда в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров, и 5 баранов;  продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также на поливной земле в 1,26 га Зивайда выращивает хлопок, арбузы и дыни, что в сезон урожая приносит прибыль от продажи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Зивайда обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и  перепродажи, и семен хлопка.    Доходы Зивайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем планирует дать образование двум внукам,  которые проживают вместе с ней.
texts.en: Zivayda lives in the Burgondu village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Much like other families in the rural area, she fattens up livestock, after starting this business in 2000 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, Zivayda has two heads of dairy cows and five sheep in her business, and sales of milk products and meat allows her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  Zivayda also grows cotton, watermelons and honeydew on 1.26 hectares of irrigated land, and earns a profit from sales during the harvesting season.  In order to further expand her business, Zivayda requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale and to buy cotton seeds.  She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount, and plans to provide education to her two grandsons, who live with her, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Lorena Piedad

texts.es:
Lorena de 22 años de edad es madre soltera con una menor hija de 2 años, vive en el distrito de Zaña, distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y al Dpto. de Lambayeque respectivamente, Zaña esta ubicada a unos 45 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo siendo una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera. Cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de los moradores de la zona en la que vive.

Lorena se dedica a la venta de Chicha de Jora y Hamburguesas, ah dicha actividad se dedica ya  aproximadamente 2 años atrás. Actividad la cual ha venido manteniendo de manera eficiente debido a que es el sustento de de ella y su hija.
 
Lorena en su afán de seguir manteniendo sus cliente y hacer cada día mas grande su negocio solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles, crédito que utilizara para la compra de insumos que sirven para la producción de Chicha de Jora.

Lorena es una persona muy conocida por su buen carácter  y sobre todo por su amabilidad a la hora de atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorena, who is 22 years old, is a single mother with a young daughter who is 2 years old. She lives in the district of Zaña, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo and the department of Lambayeque, respectively. Zaña is located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, and it is a thoroughly agricultural and livestock-raising zone. She has good references from the residents of the zone in which she lives.

Lorena sells chicha de jora (Peruvian corn beer) and hamburgers. She has already had this business for approximately 2 years, and she has been running it efficiently since it provides sustenance for her and her daughter.
 
Lorena, in her eagerness to continue serving her customers and to make her business larger every day, is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 2500 PEN, which she will use to buy the ingredients that are used to produce chicha de jora.

Lorena is a person who is well known for her good character and above all for her kindness in waiting on her customers.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients that are used to make chicha de jora (Peruvian corn beer)

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus 3 hijos, de los cuales ya 2 son independientes económicamente.  Su casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande, el cual pertenece a la provincia a de Piura, ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural de este distrito el cual poco a poco está progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Segundo vive en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera, por lo que él no es ajeno a esta actividad, siendo su principal actividad económica.  Segundo cuenta con 0.5 has de terreno agrícola, el cual está sembrado de limón de buena calidad.  Según nos refiere es un producto de exportación, a esta actividad se viene dedicando un aproximado de 6 años, debido a que anteriormente se había dedicado a la venta de animales y en sus deseo de superación ha decidido dedicarse a la siembra y buscar mejores y mas grandes mercados para su producto y así poder comprar mas has de terreno agrícola para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su esposa apoya a la canasta familiar en la venta de Chicha de Jora lo cual le genera un ingreso diario y además a la venta de animales de corral.

Y es el mismo deseo de superarse cada día para el bienestar de su familia en especial el de sus hijos ha hecho de que Segundo solicite un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para poder comprar fertilizantes los cuales servirán para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.

Segundo es un padre responsable que se preocupa por la buena alimentación y sobre todo la buena educación de sus hijos y a la vez de toda su familia por lo que se han ganado la consideración y el respeto de todos sus vecinos de los caseríos aledaños.
texts.en:
Segundo is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children, of whom two are already economically independent. The house in which they now live is located in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the province of Piura, which is located about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of this district, which is progressing a little, so for now, they only have basic electrical service.

Segundo lives in an area that is thoroughly dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, so he is not unfamiliar with these businesses, which are his principal economic activities. Segundo has 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, which is planted with lemons of good quality. As he tells us, this is an export product. He has been working in this business for approximately 6 years, because in the past he worked in the sale of animals, and in his desire to excel he decided to plant and look for better and larger markets for his products and thus be able to buy more hectares of agricultural land to improve his living conditions. His wife supports the family's basic needs with the sale of chicha de jora (a Peruvian corn-based beer), which generates a daily income, and also by the sale of farm-yard animals.

His own desire to excel every day for the well-being of his family, especially that of his children, has caused Segundo to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers which will serve to improve the quality of his products.

Because Segundo is a responsible father who is concerned for the good nourishment and above all the education of his children and at the same time for all his family, he has earned the recognition and respect of all his neighbors in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve the quality of his plantings

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en: Hadijja is a 28-year-old, hard-working lady with one child living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her child and to build a permanent home.  She has been a retailer for the last 10 years, after starting her business with one million in capital.  Now her business is worth five million.  Her major hardship is customers not paying on time, however, she has a goal of expanding her business to new areas.  Hadijja needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man.  He lives with his wife and two children, one who is working and one who is still attending school. Hussein and his daughter are both working to enhance their family’s way of living.  He has been working independently as a taxi driver since 1999, and looking forward to gaining more clients.  He is good and friendly and that makes people loyal to him.  Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his car and to pay the mechanic fees.  He is sure that this will improve his business and, therefore, increase his revenues.  In the future, he plans to buy a van and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance work for his taxi.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is forty-one years old, married, with four children, and living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a textile business which she has been operating for over ten years. She started it using her savings which she made while working with American tobacco. She faces a challenge of high price fluctuations and dreams of educating her children, and expanding her business to new markets. She intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is thirty-five years old and married to Monthe who is a housewife. They have three children aged twelve, eight and four years old. He has been selling building stones from a quarry for a period of about seven years with an income of about 12,000 KES.

He is taking his first loan from KADET Ltd. He wants to use the loan to buy a quarrying machine. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a quarrying machine.

loans.name: Lovis

texts.en: Lovis is a hard-working lady who owns a restaurant business where she sells food mainly to market vendors.  She faces the challenge of high price fluctuations and customers not paying on time.  She dreams of moving her business to a more permanent location and educating her children.  Lovis needs this loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is thirty-three years old, married and hardworking. She is a teacher by profession and loves teaching. She faces challenges of high price fluctuations which makes it hard to budget her small salary. 

Her family goal is to educate her children and construct a house. Resty needs a loan to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким более пяти лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном занимается торговлей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день он открыл продуктовый магазин в центре района. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Хаким просит кредит для покупки булочек, хлеба, кофе и натуральных соков.
texts.en: Hakim has been involved in sales for over five years.  He primarily sells food products.  Today, he has a food store in the center of the district.  Hakim is 53 years old, married and has four children.  His wife works at a dekhan farm.  Hakim is requesting this loan to purchase buns, bread, coffee and natural juices.

loans.use: to purchase buns, bread, coffee and natural juices

loans.name: Maria Yeny

texts.es:
Maria es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres.  Vive en un caserío rural ubicado a unos a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope el cual pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y esta a una 1 hora aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de la zona en la que vive se dedican netamente a la agricultura, ganadería , son caseríos rurales que están en vías de su desarrollo por lo que aun no cuentan con servicios básicos

Maria se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales menores como: patos, pavos, gallinas entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado 5 años aproximadamente, los conocimientos sobre el negocio han sido heredados de sus padres, para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos. Adicionalmente también se genera otros ingresos diarios dedicándose al corte de cabello y todo lo que se refiera a Peluquería, la unión y el cariño que existe con sus padres ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

En su deseo de seguir creciendo económicamente. Maria ha decidido invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados y a la vez comprar aves pequeñas para su comercialización, para lo cual esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 Nuevos Soles para ayudarse a cumplir con sus objetivos.

Maria es una mujer muy respetada y considerada por sus buenas acciones realizadas en su caserío donde vive.
texts.en:
Maria is a 25 year old mother who lives in her parents’ house in a rural settlement called Holleria, located some 10 minutes from Morrope District, which belongs to Lambayeque Province and is about 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo. The inhabitants in the area engage in agriculture, cattle raising and handicrafts among other activities. These are rural villages that do not have basic services.

Maria raises small animals every day, such as ducks, turkeys and chickens among others, and then markets them. She has been doing this for approximately 4 years and gained knowledge of the business from her parents. She has been able to set up strategic areas at the house for her animals. In addition she generates other income every day by cutting hair and performing all other tasks associated with a beautician. She acquired that knowledge through a technical course that her parents helped her take. The unity and affection that she shares with her parents have encouraged them to undertake new family objectives. That is why they all work every day to achieve their goals and thus better their life situation.

In her desire to continue growing economically, Maria has decided to invest in the purchase of poultry and at the same time in the purchase of small birds for commercial purposes. Consequently she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the above necessities.

Maria is a much respected woman who is held in high regard for the good deeds she performs in her village.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and animal feed

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven emprendedora de 26 años de edad, vive junto a su conyugue y a sus dos menores hijos en su domicilio el cual le dejaron sus padres como herencia. La casa en la que viven esta ubicada en Jayanca, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Desde muy pequeña Rosa trabajo junto a su madre en la producción de tamales y humitas, actividad que ahora ella misma realiza para la subsistencia de su familia, los conocimientos adquiridos de su madre la han llevado a emprender en este negocio el cual aplica de manera un poco mas estratégica debido a que no solo vende en su propio domicilio si no que también los reparte de casa en casa según sus pedidos que tenga, pues junto a su esposo se levantan muy temprano para empezar la producción y es que la unión entre ellos dos y sus hijos ha hecho que fijen sus objetivos.

Rosa desea hacer mas grande su negocio y así poder ampliar su cartera de clientes, pues considera que a pesar de haber competencia todavía hay mercado en el que ella y su esposo puedan incursionar por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles con los que podrá comprar mas insumos y adquirir nuevas herramientas de trabajo que le permitan perfeccionar su producción.

Por el tipo de trabajo que Rosa tiene es muy conocida y le ha permitido ganarse el cariño de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising young woman of 26 years of age. She lives with her spouse and two minor children in her residence which was left to her by her parents as an inheritance. The house where they live is located in Jayanca, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

From a very early age Rosa worked alongside her mother in the production of tamales and humitas, an activity she now carries out herself for the sustenance of her family. The knowledge she acquired from her mother has led her to start up this business, which she applies a bit more strategically since she sells not only from her own home but also distributes them door to door according to the orders she has. Along with her husband she gets up very early to begin producing the food, since the bond between the two of them and their children has induced them to set their objectives. 

Rosa wishes to increase the size of her business so she may expand her customer base since she believes that, in spite of the competition, there is still market share into which she and her husband could foray. So she is seeking a loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian soles with which to be able to purchase more supplies and acquire new work tools that will let her perfect her production methods. 

Rosa is very well known for the kind of work she does, and that has allowed her to gain the affection of all her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Grupo Plan De Ayala Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Plan de Ayala esta integrado por cinco integrantes mujeres trabajadoras que desean hacer mas grandes sus negocios y mejor su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Gozos Marcelina una señora humilde y trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes .
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Ubaldo un señor trabajador y humilde quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz.  Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: café,leche,galletas,manteca,verdura,sabritas y refrescos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Romelia-quien se dedica a la venta de materias primas.
Marcela-quien se dedica  a la venta de pan.
Concepcion-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Socorro-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.

Le dan las gracia a fundación por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
The group called "Plan de Ayala" is made up of five members. They are hard-working women who wish to make their businesses grow, and improve their quality of life.

One of the members of this group is Gozos Marcelina, a modest and hard-working lady who sells groceries. 

She is happily married to Ubaldo, a hard-working and modest man who grows corn. She asked for the loan to buy more grocery merchandise such as coffee, milk, cookies, butter, vegetables, snack foods, and soft drinks.

The other members of the group are Romelia, who sells basic staples, Marcela who sells bread, Concepcion who sells bread, and Socorro who sells perfumes.

They are thankful to the Foundation for helping hard-working women who want to better themselves.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is 54 years old and married with eight children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  She owns a business selling textiles, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She faces the challenge of high price fluctuations.  Her family goal is to educate her children.  Safina dreams of expanding her business to new markets.  She needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Esther is married and blessed with two children aged twenty-one and eighteen. She has a mali mali shop (a shop that sells household items), a business she started 15 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase buckets, basins, school bags, and clothes for sale.

The profit she makes will help her venture into another type of business, this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase buckets, basins, school bags, and clothes.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is 42 years old and married.  Together the couple has nine children.  He owns a charcoal business.  He started as a farmer and saved to start his current business.  He faces price fluctuations and high inflation.  His dreams are to educate his children and expand his business to new markets.  Muhammad intends to use this loan to buy charcoal and rice to sell.
