The representative of the group is Félix, who is seventy-nine years old.  He has worked for three years selling and raising cattle.  He is happily married to Gloria, a hard-working woman.  Félix tells us that to feed his cattle, he leaves very early with his water jug and his tortillas for lunch and he eats since he returns home at about six in the evening.  He then leaves with his herd to graze and give them water and the following day he has to milk them, so that Gloria can make her delicious cheeses.  He requests the loan to purchase more cattle and feed for his cows, since he needs to feed them well so that when it is time to sell them, they weigh a lot and look very healthy.  

The other members are: Juana, who works selling meat wholesale and retail, and Margarita, who works selling fresh chicken.  They are thankful to the foundation for helping hard-working people who want to better themselves, despite their age and being from small towns.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío rural de nombre “Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 74” caserío perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura. La zona en la que vive es una zona rural en donde sus habitantes normalmente se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente. Por ahora su caserío solo cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Fany se dedica a la crianza y posterior venta de animales como porcino, ovinos y en su gran mayoría aves de corral, pues ya ha generado una clientela que la solicita cada vez que necesitan de sus servicios, ella recorre caserío en caserío realizando compras de animales criarlos, engordarlos y después venderlos al mejor precio. Su esposo se ha dedicado siempre al trabajo de la agricultura para lo que trabaja como jornalero en diferentes fundos de su caserío con lo que ayuda a Fany al sustento de hogar.

Fany ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los mismo que empleara para la compra de alimentos balanceados para aumentar el peso de sus animales los cuales están por ser vendidos.

Se le conoce por su responsabilidad y dedicación al trabajo pues ya anteriormente ha sido cliente de esta institución pagando de manera puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Fany is 39 years old, is married, and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in a home of her own in the rural settlement called “Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 74,” which is part of the Tambogrande district and the Piura province.  The zone where she lives is a rural one where the residents usually exclusively farm and raise livestock.  For now, electricity is the only service in the settlement.

Fany raises and sells animals such as pigs, cattle, and mostly poultry, and has established a large number of customers who seek her out whenever they need her services.  She travels from settlement to settlement buying animals, raises them, fattens them up, and then selling them for a profit.  Her husband has always been a farmer and works daily at different farms within the settlement.  In this way he helps Fany support their home.

Fany has requested an amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa and will use the money to buy balanced feed to increase the weight of the animals she will sell.
 
She is known for being responsible and for her dedication to her work.  She has been a client of this institution in the past and has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco.  Benigno is 51 years old and married with three children between the ages of 16 and 28. For many years, he has worked as a plumber, largely on contract for construction projects. He is now looking to invest his skills in a construction project of a more personal nature: improving his house.

Benigno is requesting a loan in order to purchase home improvement materials such as paint, concrete, and plaster. He looks forward to improving the physical structure and beautifying the exterior, including a new layer of gray paint. Benigno has lived in his house for 12 years and hopes that the loan will enable him to provide a more comfortable home for his family.

loans.use: purchase home improvement materials

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Judith is 30 years old. She lives with a partner and is raising two children, a 2.5-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter. Judith has worked as a refrigerator technician for eight years and shares a work space with her parents, who run a separate business. Additionally, Judith runs a business selling hardware on Saturdays.

Judith is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as pliers, hammers, and kitchen spare parts for her hardware supply shop. Her business is still small but she hopes to grow it as much as possible and one day own a large and successful shop.

loans.use: buy hardware merchandise

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. David is 31 years old and single. He owns and operates a metal workshop with his brother. From the age of 15, David has worked in the shop constructing all types of metal structures for his customers, including verandas, stairs, handrails, windows, furniture, and doors.

David is requesting a loan in order to purchase metal working materials such as machinery, tools, and sheet metal. Using the returns from his investments, David dreams that one day he will be able to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: buy metal working materials, machinery and tools

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Antonia is 54 years old and, with her partner, is raising four children between the ages of 14 and 25. For the past three years, Antonia has been working as a housemaid in order to support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase home improvement materials such as plaster, paint, and cement to renovate her house.  Antonia has been living in her house for two years and hopes to provide a more comfortable environment for her family. She dreams of seeing her children complete their education and attain professional degrees.

loans.use: buy materials to improve her house

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Margarita is a member of the group Fe y Accion 1 (Faith and Action). This group, like many others, runs its businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc.

Margarita operates a Fantasia, a small business where she sells miscellaneous products. She has been in business for over five years, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it.

She is excited to be taking a group loan of 117,000 DOP, her seventh, with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use her portion of this loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc. to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

Margarita is very happy for your support, and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!!!

loans.use: to buy products to sell from her Fantasia.

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Rum, 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). 

She has been selling fish at the market for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her son is also a construction worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling, Rum is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell at the market. 

In the future, she would like to run a laundry at home to generate extra income for the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales y Comercio Exterior, está en el último año, y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Miguel es un joven trabajador y con sus ingresos pagará el préstamo. Sus sueños son trabajar en la cancillería de la república o estar en un consulado fuera de Nicaragua. Le inspira el poder ayudar su país y a las personas necesitadas y sobre todo le inspira su mamá que siempre le ha apoyado.
texts.en: Miguel is a young student studying International Relations and External Commerce. He is in his last year and he is requesting a loan to pay for his final classes. Miguel is a hardworking young man and with his income, he will pay the loan. His dreams are to work in the republic’s state department or to work in a consulate outside of Nicaragua. He is inspired to be able to help his country and people in need, and above all, he is inspired by his mother, who has always supported him.

loans.use: to pay for his final classes for graduation

loans.name: Kenia Valeska

texts.es: Kenia está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y así poder obtener su título de Licenciatura en Química y Farmacia. Actualmente trabaja como auxliar contable. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener éxito en su carrera, poder desempeñarse en el carrera que estudió, y así poder ayudar a sus padres, y asegurar un buen futuro para su familia. Creció en una familia trabajadora que todos los días lucha por salir adelante. Espera poder trabajar como regente de farmacia o visitadora médica.
texts.en: Kenia is requesting the loan to pay for her final classes so that she can graduate with her bachelor’s degree in Chemistry and Pharmacy. She is currently working as an assistant accountant. Her greatest dream in life is be successful in her studies, to be able to work in the career she studied for, and to be able to help her parents and assure a good future for her family. She grew up in a hardworking family that works hard every day to get ahead. She hopes to work as a pharmacist or a pharmaceutical sales representative.

loans.use: to pay for her final classes for graduation

loans.name: Marjorie Leslania

texts.es: Marjorie está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de tiutlación de la carrera que está estudiando, Química y Farmacia, una carrera con duarción de 4 años. Dentro de 5 años se ve con una farmacia propia, grande, surtida y dando buena atención a sus clientes, con descuentos y atención médica. Ella también es una pequeña comerciante de venta de productos cosméticos por catálogos, y de esa forma está pagando sus estudios.
texts.en: Marjorie is requesting a loan to pay for her final classes so she can graduate with the degree she is studying for, Chemistry and Pharmacy, a degree that takes 4 years. Within five years she sees herself owning a pharmacy that is large, well-stocked, that provides good service to its clients, with discounts and medical attention. She is also a small businesswoman and sells cosmetic products from catalogs; this is how she pays for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her final classes for graduation

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es: Rosa de 33 años de edad tiene 3 niños, el mayor estudiando la primaria y los 2 menores que son gemelitos en preescolar, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Rosa Aura labora como docente desde hace mas de 11 años. Esta solicitando su credito con el objetivo de instalar los servicios basicos (agua potable y luz eléctrica) en su propia casa, pues anteriormente estaba alquilando.  Cabe mencionar que con sus creditos anteriores logro comprar un solar y posteriormente levantar aunque sea de madera su casita.
texts.en: 33-year-old Rosa has three children.  Her eldest is in elementary school and her two youngest (twins) are in pre-school.  Her life partner works as a builder and supports her with their household expenses.  Rosa Aura has been working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Fuente de Vida High School for more than 11 years.  She is requesting her 11th loan to install basic services (drinking water and electricity) in her home as she previously rented.  We should mention that she used her previous loans to buy a plot of land and then build her small house, albeit from wood.

loans.use: to install basic services of water and electricity

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El socio se siegue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carroq ue hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar su carro que hace servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar llantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues his transportation business.  He has a car which he uses to provide taxi services and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  He wants to get ahead through this business.  His dream is to fix up his taxi and he is requesting a loan to buy new tires.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nieve is the coordinator of the group "Mata de Palma en Desarrollo" group 1 & 2, (Palm tree in development) named like this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes 10 micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Nieve's family includes herself, her long-term partner and her eight children. Nieve is very excited to receive her 13th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly repaid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about eight years. She started it when she took her first loan.

 Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products, but she will use this loan to buy medicine and veterinary instruments.  She is a veterinarian. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine and veterinary instruments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Vencia

texts.en:
Vencia, 56, lives in Dolipos Bajo, a neighborhood of Oroquieta City in Misamis Province. She is married with two children.

Vencia sells barbecue to eat and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Chaka est âgé de 48 ans marié à deux épouses et est père de 5 enfants. Il vit dans la ville de Koutiala  avec sa famille. 
Son enfance a été perturbée par des problèmes familiaux qui lui ait empêché  d’étudier. Pour pouvoir réussir dans la vie,  il  n’a pas  pris du temps à embrasser les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il décide de faire  la vente des poissons, séchés, fumés, qu’il appris auprès de ses amis il y a 22 ans. 
Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Il est à son 2eme prêt individuel après avoir remboursé le premier. 
Il compte acheter des paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé  (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somono et effectue sa vente au  marché de poisson de Koutiala,  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte  réaliser un profit de 95.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Chaka is 48 years old. He has two wives and is the father of five children. He lives in the town of Koutiala with his family. His childhood has been marked by family problems  that prevented him from studying. In order to be able to succeed in life, he lost no time in learning from his father how to make a living. After trying various activities without success, he decided to sell fish (dried, smoked etc), which is a business he learned from business 22 years ago.

In order to be able to increase his working capital and bolster his sales volume, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan, having reimbursed the first one.

He plans to buy baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (Mopti Region) from fishers of Bozo and Somono origins, and sells at the fish marked of Koutiala, to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash and on credit. He plans to achieve an income of 95,000 West African Francs per month, which he will use to repay the Soro Yiriwaso loan, cover family expenses and reinvest the rest  in his business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Jaynagul

texts.ru:
Жайнагул 32 года, замужем, воспитывает пятерых детей, младшему из которых один год. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Жайнагул откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году с покупки 10 овец. На сегодняшний день, Жайнагул в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров, 10 голов овец и 2 теленка;  продажа молока и молочных продуктов позволяет получать около 4,500 сом (KGS) в месяц.   
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Жайнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной дойной коровы.    Доходы Жайнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jaynagul is 32 years old, married and raising five children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  Much like many other families in the rural area, Jaynagul fattens up livestock after starting this business in 2000 with a purchase of ten sheep.  Today, her business contains two heads of dairy cows, ten heads of sheep and two calves, and the sales of milk and milk products allow her to earns about 4,500 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further expand her business, Jaynagul requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. 

Marites is a farmer. She raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14900 to pay for her son's elementary education tuition fee. 

Marites has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To pay for her son's elementary education tuition fee

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio tiene 39 años de edad conviviente con la señora Victoria más de 18 años con un nivel de instrucción primaria, tienen 8 hijos de los cuales estudian 6, la familia vive en la comunidad de Huancuni hacia el norte de Colomi de la ciudad de Cochabamba a orillas del lago más de 18 años.                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Son agricultores cultivan Papa,Haba, Oca, Papaliza, una parte cultivan en terreno de 4 has herencia de sus padres en la misma comunidad y la otra parte en un terreno propio de 1 ha en la comunidad Paracti, cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 3 lecheras, 1 de engorde más 2 terneros; Don Gregorio y su esposa hicieron construir una vivienda nueva donde invirtieron todo el ahorro que tenían, les falto dinero para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) aprovechando el precio bajo por la época y también para la compra de  productos agroquímicos, por este motivo ellos se apersonaron a nuestra Institución Cidre a solicitar préstamo.                                                                                                       El señor Gregorio y su familia nos dicen que están muy felices por haber tenido esta oportunidad ahora tendrán una vivienda para vivir más cómodos y como también apoyando a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando  para que de esta manera tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 39 years old.  He has been living together with his partner, Victoria, for more than 18 years.  He has an elementary school level of education.  The couple have 8 children, 6 of whom are in school.  They live in Huancuni community, toward the north of Colomi, in the city of Cochabamba, on the shores of the lake.  They have lived there for 18 years.

Gregorio and his partner are farmers.  They grow potatoes, beans, 'oca' and 'papalisa' (native tubers).  They grow some of their crops on 4 hectares of farmland that they inherited from their parents in their own community and some on a 1 hectare plot of land that they own in Paracti community.  They also own 3 dairy cows, 1 cow which is raised for meat and 2 calves.  Gregorio and his partner built a new house in which they invested all of their savings.  They now need money to buy organic fertilizer (manure from laying hens) so that they can make the most of the low price at this time of year.  They also need to buy chemical products.  For this reason, they came to Cidre to request a loan.

Gregorio and his family tell us that they are very happy to have this opportunity.  Now they will have a home in which they can live more comfortably and will also be able to support their children so that they can stay in school and thereby enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Julio Marcelo

texts.es: El cliente Julio Marcelo, es un señor de 26 años de edad, es soltero, trabaja en una empresa de telecomunicaciones en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, vive en alquiler, el cliente vive solo y su familia se encuentra muy lejos. El destino del  crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta, el cliente necesita en que transportarse desde su domicilio hacia el trabajo porque le queda muy lejos, es de un extremo de la ciudad hacia el otro extremo, lo cual es muy demoroso cruzar toda la ciudad de Cochabamba. y además los gastos que realiza en los pasajes es de mucha consideración, porque hay días que vuelve más de 2 veces a su domicilio del trabajo y viceversa, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The client, Julio Marcelo, is a 26-year-old single man.  He works in a telecommunications company in the city of Cochabamba.  Currently he lives in the northern part of the city.  The house he lives in is not his own; he rents.  He lives alone and his family is very far away.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a motorcycle.  The client needs transportation from his home to work because it is very far, from one side of the city to the other, which is very slow, crossing the entire city of Cochabama.  Also, the expense for the tickets is a big consideration because some days he returns home from work and back again more than twice.  We tell this little story about the client so all of you are aware.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives in Dampalan, Dapitan City.
Rosie sells vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3600 from her business. She has requested a loan for PHP 3000 to purchase new stock to sell.
Rosie has been a member of PMPC for less than a year.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 49 years old and lives in Lumipac, Baliangao. She is married with 1 child. 
To earn a living, Marilyn runs a general store business. She earns about PHP 3600 each month doing this type of work. Marilyn has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa forma parte del Banco comunal “La Gula”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía desde hace 20 años. Específicamente realiza tejidos a máquina, en un taller que tiene habilitado en el living- comedor de su propia casa.
Comenta que comenzó en éste rubro, cuando trabajaba de manera dependiente en una empresa vendiendo lanas, posteriormente la mandaron a capacitarse, por lo que hizo un curso de tejidos, aprendiendo de ésta manera el oficio, con el tiempo se dio cuenta que le gustaban las manualidades y se compró su primera máquina, para después independizarse. Actualmente realiza piezas de tejidos con diferentes diseños, por lo que teje mucho, además cuenta con dos grandes clientes, que compran su artesanía al por mayor, para venderla posteriormente en forma particular. Uno de estos clientes es una tienda de ropa exclusiva en la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Por lo que también realiza pantalones, chalecos, poleras y otros diseños de ropa femenina innovadora. 
Su mercadería, esencialmente “lana”, la compra en la ligua (sector conocido por su artesanía textil).
Una de las metas para su negocio es ampliar su casa, para habilitar su taller en otra ubicación de su casa.
Con el crédito comprará lana al por mayor.
María Luisa comenta que es separada desde hace tres años. Por lo que actualmente vive con sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal, son brindarles una mejor calidad en la educación a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy responsable y comprometido. Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar de mejor manera la contabilidad de su negocio.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
María Luisa is a member of the communal bank "La Gula" in the city of Valparaíso.

She has made a living in the field of artisan crafts for 20 years. Specifically, she makes weavings with a power loom in a workshop that she has set up in the dining room of her house. 

She says she began in this field when she worked for a company selling wool. Later they sent her for training where she did a course in weaving. In this way she learned the trade. Over time she realized that she liked handicrafts and she bought her first power loom so that she could work independently. Currently she makes woven pieces with different designs, as she weaves a lot. Additionally, she has two big customers who buy her handicrafts at wholesale and then resell them at retail. One of these customers is an exclusive clothing store in the city of Viña del Mar. She also makes pants, vests, t-shirts, and other innovative designs in women's clothing. She buys her merchandise, essentially "wool", in La Ligua (an area known for its artisanal textiles). One of her goals is to add-on to her house so that she can install her workshop in another area of the house. With this loan she will buy wholesale wool. 

María Luisa mentions that she has been separated for three years. Right now she lives with her two children who are 16 and 10 years old. Her personal dreams are to give her children a better quality education. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her as it allows her to invest in her business. She says that the communal bank group that she is a part of is very responsible and committed. With respect to the trainings, they have helped her to better organize her business accounting.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers north-west of Santiago. It is a regional capital in addition to being the seat of the national legislature. It is the main port of the nation and has a lot of beautiful and picturesque places such as the home of the poet Pablo Neruda, a winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: San Juan Potrerito Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 10 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación. Ellas tienen experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que  son meses  los que trabajan juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, y debatir cuestiones de su grupo. Ellas están muy esperanzadas en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación.
Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de alimentos, y nos cuenta que tiene muy buena sazón para la comida, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Su sueño es poder tener un local donde pueda vender los alimentos que prepara.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, condimentos, y otros insumos que necesita para preparar los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da de progresar.
texts.en:
The committee is composed of 10 members of the city of Encarnación. They have experience in group work. Already working together for months, they met each week to share and discuss issues of the group. They are very hopeful int the women's program committee of the foundation.

Maria is one of the members of the group. She sells all types of food for a living and tells us that she has a great flavor for food, so she already has a well formed customer base. Her dream is to be able to have a place where she can sell the food that she prepares. She is requesting a loan in order to buy meat, baked goods, condiments and other supplies that she needs to prepare the food that she sells. She is thankful to the foundation and kiva for the opportunity they are giving her to progress.

loans.use: to buy meat, baked goods, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Pirayu Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cuidad de Caacupé. Las Sras del comité de Mujeres Unidas de Pirayu, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades de los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y de ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la señora Maria, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesania en ñanduti en especial a hacer los sombreros de ñanduti, tambien hace polleras de danza, cuadros, detalles para pegar sobre ropa hecho en arasape y también ao po'i. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre ellas y ayudarse de esa forma.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas, y demás insumos necesarios para hacer sus tejidos de ñanduti. Están muy contentas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  The ladies who belong to the "Mujeres Unidas de Pirayu" committee are very hard-working people who are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, thanks to their loan terms, they are able to access loans and invest in their businesses.  Others are able to set up a new business.

The group's president is Maria, who lives with her husband and children.  Her business is making handicrafts from 'ñanduti' (fine Paraguayan lace).  In particular, she makes hats from 'ñanduti'.  She also makes traditional dance skirts, tapestries and notions to stick onto clothing made from arasape and ao po'i (Paraguayan cotton fabric).  She carries out constant activities together with her fellow committee members and, in this way, they foster good team spirit and help each other out.

Maria is requesting the help of Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy thread, needles, fabric and other supplies she needs to make her items from 'ñanduti'.  All the members of the group are very happy for the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Sras del comité Las tejedoras, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades de los créditos ellas pueden acceder a él y de ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la señora Norma vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti y también vende ropas. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, y nos comenta que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos para poder seguir haciendo los tejidos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The ladies who belong to "Las Tejedoras" community bank are very hard-working people.  They are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, thanks to the terms of their loans, they are able to access them and thus are able to invest in their existing businesses or start a new business.

The president of this group, Norma, lives with her husband and children.  Her business is making handicrafts from ñanduti (Paraguayan lace).  She also sells clothes.  Together with her fellow group members, she carries out constant activities in order to promote good team spirit and try to bring forward their repayments.  Norma describes herself as a very hard-working and tenacious person and she tells us that she always works as hard as she can so that she is able to help her husband with their household expenses and provide for their children.

Norma is requesting this loan to buy fabric and threads so that she can continue making her embroidered products.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité está integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y sus familias, desean poder mejorar el estilo de vida de sus hijos y evitar que pasen por privaciones.
Una de las integrantes, es la señora Silvia, quien comenta que con mucho esfuerzo ha trabajo y hecho prosperar la despensa que tiene, empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero a medida que pasaba el tiempo se esforzaba más y más para poder seguir creciendo como profesional. Su meta es seguir trabajando para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lácteos, bebidas, comestibles, enlatados y demás insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá seguir adelante con su microempresa.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 12 women from the city of Encarnación.  They are all heads of families who have seen Fundación Paraguaya's program as a great opportunity to make progress for themselves and their families.  They would like to be able to improve their children's lifestyles and avoid them having to suffer hardships.

One of the group's members is Silvia.  She says that with a lot of hard work she has prospered and improved the store that she has. She began with a small business but as time went on she tried harder and harder to begin growing as a professional. Her goal is to continue working to be able to keep helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase milk products, drinks, perishable goods, canned goods, and other supplies with which she can continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk products, drinks, perishable and canned goods, and other goods.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un padre de familia de 58 años, el tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa en un caserío rural donde sus habitantes normalmente se dedican al la agricultura y ganadería específicamente, el caserío lleva por nombre “Huaca Blanca” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande el cual es dependiente de la provincia de Piura. Su caserío por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de Luz Eléctrica.

Alejandro se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la crianza de animales como: ganado vacuno, ovinos entre otros, actividad que hasta ahora el lleva administrando, pues no ha descuidado su cliente generada anteriormente, adicionalmente junto a su esposa y con la ayuda de sus hijos han implementando un pequeño negocio de venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y comida en instalaciones de su propia casa, pues hasta ahora le va muy bien dado que ya tienen sus propios clientes también en ese rubro.

Alejandro desea comprar alimentos balanceados con los que podrá alimentar a sus animales y  ponerlos a mejor precio y promocionarlos en los mercados locales o también en mercados de otros caseríos donde también ya es conocido por su antigüedad en el negocio. Y a la vez comprar parte del mobiliario que necesita para seguir implementado su segundo negocio Por ese motivo Alejandro esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1800 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos en lo que antes se menciona.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 58, is the father of a family.  He has two adult children and lives in his home together with his wife in a rural village whose residents typically work in agriculture, and cattle raising specifically.  The village named "Huaca Blanca" belongs to the Tambogrande district, which is a part of the Piura province.  His village currently only has electricity.

Since he was small, Alejandro has worked raising animals like cows and sheep among others, a task that he still carries out.  He hasn't neglected his customers generated previously.  Additionally, together with his wife and with the help of his children, they have implemented a small business selling chicha de jora (a native corn-based beverage), beer and food within their own home.  At this time, it is going very well for them, given that they already have their own customers in that area.

Alejandro wants to purchase balanced food that he can feed to his animals and sell them at a better price, promoting them in the local markets as well as the markets of other villages where he is also already known for his many years in the business.  At the same time, he wants to purchase some of the equipment necessary to continue implementing his second business.  For this reason, Alejandro is requesting a loan in Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1800 Nuevos Soles, which will be invested in the aforementioned ways.

loans.use: to purchase balanced food and equipment for his business.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La señora Miguelina, obtiene ingresos de los  alquileres  de las habitaciones de su casa. 
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación más para alquilar, lo que le dará ingresos extras  para la  mejor manutención de su familia.
Ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos en casa propia ubicada en la zona de San Pedro ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Señora Miguelina earns income by renting out rooms in her home.

She is requesting the loan to build another room to rent out, which will provide her with extra income to support her family better.

She is a widow with two children. She lives with her children in her own home, located in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

This is her first time working with IMPRO, and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to build another room in her home for her to rent out and improve her income.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La  Sra. Teresa es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Ascencio de 59 años de edad, tienen 3 hijos todos ya mayores que trabajan de manera independiente.
La señora Teresa tiene una Merceria en el Mercado Municipal, donde vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser prendas de todo tipo, calzados y de más. Cuenta que tiene una clientela formada, gracias a los años que lleva trabajando en esto y eso le ha dado un buen ingreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, pantalones, y demás con lo que podrá seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is from the city of Santani. She is 51 years old and is married to Sr. Ascencio, who is 59. They have three children; all of them are already adults who work independently.

Señora Teresa has a store in the municipal market of Santani, where she sells every type of article, such as clothing of all types, footwear, and more. She tells us that she has a regular clientele, thanks to the years that she has been working in this business, and this has given her a good income.

She is applying for the loan to purchase clothing of all types, such as T shirts, pants, and other items with which she will be able to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres  Valientes” se formó gracias al espíritu emprendedor que las mueve, su integrantes redoblan esfuerzos tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de darles a sus hijos la posibilidad de educarse  y de esa forma poder tener un buen trabajo el día de mañana.
Avelina es una de las miembros de este grupo, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas desde hace un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende. Comenta que su meta es poder seguir creciendo como comerciante y de esa forma seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, pues se acerca la época de calor y es cuando más ventas tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que le da fundación paraguaya y kiva.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Valientes” [“Brave Women”] group was established thanks to the enterprising spirit of its members.  The members have redoubled their efforts to improve their incomes and thus be able to offer their children the opportunity of an education so they can have a good job someday.  

Avelina is one of the members of the group.  She makes a living selling clothing, which she has done for a while.  She already has a well-defined clientele that always buys the clothing she sells.  She says that her goal is to continue growing as a retailer and thus keep helping her family.  

Avelina is asking for a loan so she can purchase summer clothing, since the hot season is when she makes the most sales.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Vencedoras” es de la ciudad de Asunción, se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, cuenta con 12 integrante, todas ellas se esfuerzan cada día para brindarles un futuro distinto a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Martha, quien se dedica al reciclaje de plásticos y otros productos. Ella nos comenta que todos los días recorre por las calles buscando productos para poder reciclar y de esa forma poder llevar el pan a su familia. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno, y por sobre todo honrado.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, para luego revenderlos con una ganancia, ya que ello le será de mucha utilidad. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que recibe, pues le será mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Vencedoras" in the city of  Asunción is in the first cycle of the program Enterprising Women of the Paraguayan Foundation.  It has 12 members, all of whom work hard every day to bring a different future for their families.  
One of these women is Mrs. Martha who makes a living in the recycling of plastics and other products.  She tells us that she goes through the streets every day looking for items that can be recycled and this way provide bread for her family. She says that she is very proud of what she does since it is a worthy and above all honorable job.
She is requesting the loan for the purchase of plastics, which she will resell at a profit which will be very beneficial to her.  She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunities that she receives which are of much help to her.

loans.use: to purchase plastic items for resale.

loans.name: Grupo La  Boquilla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Grupo  la Boquilla  esta conformado por  tres hombres trabajadores ,humildes e indígenas orgullosos de sus raíces y orgullosos de fundación por abrirles las puertas para que puedan seguir con sus negocios y así mejor sus vidas y las de sus familias .
Uno de los integrantes del grupo es  el señor  Leuterio  Sadot un señor trabajador  humilde  que  se dedica a la venta de  ropa desde hace cuatro años.
Esta felizmente  casado con  la señora  Silvina una señora trabajadora y humilde quien lo apoya en todo ya que juntos tienen dos hijos por el cual los dos trabajan para darles una mejor  vida y una buena educación .
Don Leuterio  Sadot  nos cuenta que lo que mas  le gusta de su trabajo y de su familia es que todos se apoyan entre si para que puedan darle una buena atención a los clientes  y les compren .
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para dama caballero y niños  ya que  sus clientes en ocasiones le compran por mayoreo .
Los otros integrantes del grupo son: 
Justino- quien se dedica a la venta de carne fresca de res y de marrano.
Alfredo Guillermo – quien se dedica a la venta de carne fresca de res.
 Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a los hombres que desean ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus familias y ayudar a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
This group is called the Boquilla and is made up of three hard-working, humble, and indigenous men who are proud of their roots and proud of the foundation for opening doors for them so that they can continue with their businesses and thus, improve their lives and the lives of their families.

One of the members of the group is Leuterio Sador, a hard-working and humble man who has worked in clothing sales for the past four years.  He is happily married to Silvina, a hard-working and humble woman who supports him in everything.  Together they have two children, for whom they both work in order to give them a better life and a good education.

Leutorio Sador tells us that what he enjoys most about his work and his family is that everyone supports each other so that they can give good service to the customers that buy from them.

He requests the loan in order to purchase more clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children since his customers on occasion buy wholesale.

The other members of the group are:

Justino - who works selling fresh beef and pork

Alfredo Guillermo - who works selling fresh beef

They are grateful to the foundation for helping men who want to offer a better life to their families and help their children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de bisuteria,ella hace aretes,collares y pulseras y luego lo vende en las diferentes tiendas de artesania,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ampliar el negocio de venta de bisuteria.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aretes,collares y pulseras y tambien materiales como alambres,hilos y piedritas. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues working in the jewelry sales business.  She makes earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, and then sells them in the different craft stores.  She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m and through this business, she helps her children get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her jewelry sales business.  She requests the loan to purchase earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and also materials like wires, threads and beads.

She is very happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and also materials like wires, thread, and beads.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is thirty years old. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband works as a driver.

For the past twelve years Claudine has been selling charcoal. With a 500,000 RWF loan from UOB she will buy more charcoal to sell. Claudine plans to save the profits.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava  esta integrado por diez  personas trabajadoras humildes con deseos de superarse y hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Inés María  de cuarenta años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos como es : enchiladas rojas, enchiladas  verdes, sopes  ,tacos dorados y de guisados vende lo que es caldo de res con verduras y barbacoa de pollo.
Esta felizmente  casada con el señor  Francisco Javier  con quien tiene cinco hijos por quien la señora María Inés trabaja ya que desea darles un mejor futuro y que estén orgullosa de ella.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ingredientes como son: chiles verdes, chiles  secos ,pollo,tomate,verduras ,aceite, sal , verduras y manteca.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Clemencia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Beatriz Gertrudis-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Norma  Magolirios-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía  de abarrotes.
Sixto Ricardo-quien se dedica ala elaboración de muebles.
Evarista Flora-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Josefa Rufa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Julia-quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Martina-quien se  dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Luis  Javier-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.

Le dan las gracias  a fundación Realidad  por apoyarlos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is named Costa Brava and is made up of ten hardworking, modest people who want to improve themselves and make their small businesses grow.  One of the members is Inés María, 40, who works selling Mexican snacks such as red enchiladas, green enchiladas, "sopes" [thick tortillas with toppings], taquitos, and "guisado" [stew] tacos.  She sells beef broth with vegetables and chicken barbecue.

She is happily married to Francisco Javier, with whom she has five children for whom María Inés works, because she wants to give them a better future and for them to be proud of her.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients, such as green chiles, dried chiles, chicken, tomato, vegetables, oil, salt, and lard.

The other members of the group are Clemencia, who sells Mexican snacks; Beatriz Gertrudis, who sells clothing; Norma Magolirios, who sells grocery merchandise; Sixto Ricardo, who makes furniture; Evarista Flora, who sells clothing; Josefa Rufa, who sells clothing; Julia, who sells shoes; Martina, who sells Mexican snacks; and Luis Javier, who sells fish.

They thank Fundación Realidad for supporting them so they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Jilma Guillermina

texts.es: Jilma Guillermina es una emprendedora, que la actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería, este negocio lo emprended de la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Jilma con fondos propios inicia este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos del sector donde ella habita, y otros son clientes eventuales. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio, ella comprara granos básicos, jabón, detergente, aceite, pan, entre otros productos que demanda sus clientes.
texts.en: Jilma Guillermina is an entrepreneur who works at a general store.  She undertook this business out of the necessity of supporting some of the household expenses.  With her own funds, Jilma started this business.  The majority of her customers are neighbors of the area where she lives and others are eventual customers.  This entrepreneur is requesting financing to invest in the business.  She will purchase staple goods, soap, detergent, oil, and bread, among other products that her customers demand.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods, soap, detergent, oil, and bread, among other products that her customers demand.

loans.name: Shariffa

texts.en:
Shariffa is a married woman who has a three-year-old daughter. She describes herself as an honest woman.

For the past three years Shariffa has operated a stall from which she sells food and snacks. Her stall is in a location conducive to businesses such as hers, and her primary customers are local residents. Harassment by the health officials is her biggest challenge.

Shariffa will use her 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to pay for a new food stall. Her goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to pay for a new food stall.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 66 years old and lives in East Poblacion, Rizal. She is single with no children. 

Delia owns a general store, and she has been in this business for three years. Delia has been a member of PMPC for five years. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Susi

texts.en:
Susi is 49 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Susi requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 21 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Susi would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru:
Айнагул проживает в селе Байшкайынды на севере Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Айнагул откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году со стартовой суммы 40,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Айнагул в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров, 10 голов овец и 4 лошади;  продажа молока и молочных продуктов позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также Айнагул занимается рукоделием – изготавливает ковровые изделия и продает их на местном рынке. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец  для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы Айнагул планирует вложить в реконструкцию сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Ainagul lives in the village of Bashkayindy in the north of Kyrgyzstan. As many other families in the rural areas Ainagul fattens livestock and she started this business in 2009 with a starting capital of 40,000 son (KGS). Today Ainagul has two milk cows, ten heads of sheep and four horses. The sales of milk and dairy products let's her receive around 5,000 som a month. Also Ainagul is engaged in crafts - she makes rugs and sells them on the local market.

She has come to Bai Tushum and Partners with a goal to further develop her business and ask for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and reselling. Ainagul's plans to invest the income to repair the shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Erongul

texts.ru: Эронгул проживает в районе Хамадони. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Эронгул имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Erongul lives in the Hamadoni region. She is married and has four children. Erongul has secondary education. She has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle.

loans.name: Gulbonu

texts.ru: Гулбону уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Gulbonu has been doing animal husbandry for four years now. She is 42 years old. She is married and has five children. She is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали 35 - летний женатый мужчина. У него двое детей. Он предоставляет услугу. Шерали работает в парикмахерской. В этой области он работает десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения стола и кресла.
texts.en: Sherali is 35 years old and married. He has two children. Sherali works in the barber shop and provides a service. He has been working in this field for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy a table and chairs.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra.Elizabeth ; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, la socia distribuye a la ciudad de Lima y también trabaja como docente del nivel primario en un colegio en el distrito de Maras, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the 'SEÑOR PASION' community bank which is located in Yucay district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Elizabeth is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling corn.  She distributes her produce in the city of Lima.  She also works as a teacher in a school in Maras district.  She would like to improve her corn sales business.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to improve her corn sales business

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el trabaja en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trabajo como transportista.El  socio solicita el préstamo para  mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in the transport business.  He has a car with which he provides a taxi service.  He works from 8.00am to 6.00pm in different streets in the city of Cusco.  Through this business, he would like to get ahead in life.  This member's dream is to improve his business as a transport provider.  He is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy spare parts.

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Chroeut

texts.en:
Chroeut, 51, is a married woman with seven children. The family lives in Pouk in Siem Reap province. Since she was a single woman living with her parents, Chroeut has farmed rice and woven handmade bamboo baskets to sell.

Chroeut would like to raise pigs to sell but hasn’t enough money to do so. As a result, she is now taking out a 1,000,000 KHR loan from HKL to buy some piglets. Chroeut hopes to increase her household income with this new business.

loans.use: to buy some piglets.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 61 years old and married with five children. Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and vegetable vending.

Trinidad requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF. 

Trinidad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Hossana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hossana lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas en Ana María de 40 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años. Este negocio lo inicio con lo que ganaba lavando y planchando y poco a poco la empezó y fue creciendo. Ella tiene dos hijos de 11 y 21 años ambos estudian uno está en primaria y el otro en 2 año de la Universidad.
Su meta es componer su casa lo cual va logrando con las ganancias de poco a poco.
Las otras integrantes son Socorro de 40 años quien comercializa perfumes y sandalias desde hace 5 años y Patricia del Carmen vende ropa desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Hossana Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Ana María, 40, who has had a general store for eight years.  She started this business with what she was earning washing and ironing, and little by little she began it and it grew.  She has two children, ages 11 and 21.  Both study, one in elementary school and the other in the second year of college.  Her goal is to improve her house, which she is doing with her profits little by little.

The other members are Socorro, 40, who has sold perfume and sandals for five years; and Patricia del Carmen, who has sold clothing for five years.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Celinda; ella tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de transporte ella tiene un bus interprovincial el cual la socia lo administra, el bus sale todos los días en la ruta del Valle Sagrado tiene su chofer el cual maneja el bus y muy de vez en cuando su esposo también maneja, la socia a la vez es docente del nivel primario en el colegio nacional de Urubamba siendo estas dos las únicas actividades que realiza por el momento para así poder sacar a su familia adelante. La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento del carro y comprar algunos accesorios que le hacen falta. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'SEÑOR PASION' community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Celinda is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  Celinda has a bus which covers routes between provinces.  The bus runs every day on the Valle Sagrado route.  She has a driver who drives the bus and, very occasionally, her husband also drives it.  Celinda also works as an elementary school teacher at a school in Urubamba.  These are the only two business activities she is currently engaged in and they enable her to provide for her family.  Celinda is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on her vehicle and to buy some items that she needs.

Celinda is happy to be receiving her loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her vehicle and to buy some items that she needs

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 58 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from buying and selling other livestock.

Vergie is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jrout

texts.en:
Jrout is a 44-year-old single parent who resides in the Pouk district with five single children. Her other children live separately around the province. 

Jrout is an expert bamboo basket maker, earning approximately 3 USD per day. She usually wholesales her products in bulk to middlemen, who frequently come through the commune to collect them. 

Jrout is taking out her fifth loan from HKL and her first from Kiva to purchase a bike for her children, who are attending school far away from home, and to buy a battery for household use. Jrout will continue to work hard in order to provide further education for her school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase a bike and a battery for household use.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 38 years old and married with two children, aged 19 and ten. Her husband works as a farmer and welder.

Arlyn has been in rice farming for six years. She sells her harvest at the market and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. Arlyn works hard to send her children to school. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies. This will help Arlyn fund her farm and achieve a better yield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 36, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a driver, and she is a mother to her three children. 

Marilou retails toys and calendars. She buys toys and calendars from wholesalers, then she repacks them and sells them at a profit. Her products include balloons, plastic toys, cars, and other similar items.  Her low selling prices and the many options she offers attract customers, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day. Marilou and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of toy products to expand her inventory. She expects an income boost as she expands her business.  

Marilou dreams of expanding her business and providing for her children’s education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy toys for sale.

loans.name: Epa

texts.en:
Epa is 57 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Epa runs a general store in the Philippines; she has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, spices, noodles, eggs, and snack foods. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Epa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia  de  42 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, la casa en la que viven esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Santa Elena” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande a unas horas de la provincia de Piura, en el caserío donde Elmer vive los pobladores tienen como actividad principal la agricultura y la ganadería, actividades que siempre ha sido el sustento de sus hogar de cada uno de ellos.


Elmer desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales como, ganado vacuno, ganado ovino y aves de corral en su mayoría, para criar sus animales Elmer acondicionó una parte de su vivienda en la que cría, alimenta y promociona sus animales a sus clientes.
Además de dedicarse a la venta de sus animales se dedica a la agricultura para lo que ha sembrado en 1 has propia plantaciones de limón el cual esta cosechando semanalmente, él recibe el apoyo incondicional de su parte de su esposa y de sus hijos quienes participan de alguna manera en los negocios.

Elmer es un cliente no bancarizado, y desea por primera vez solicitar un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa con el fin de hacer cada día mas grande su negocio para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. el monto del crédito solicitado es de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán destinado a la compra de alimentos balanceados para su ganado y a la vez la compra de fertilizantes para sus plantación de limón.

Elmer y su familia cuentan con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales de parte de sus vecinos donde viven.
texts.en:
Elmer is a family man, aged 42, who lives with his wife and their two children in their own house in Santa Elena, a hamlet in the district of Tambogrande located a few hours from the province of Piura. In the village where Elmer lives, the main activity is farming and cattle breeding, which has always provided for the needs of every household.

Elmer has been busy with livestock since he was a young boy, breeding mostly cattle, sheep and poultry.  He allotted part of his house to breeding and feeding his animals and selling them to his customers. In addition to selling cattle, he also grows lemons in his own field, which he harvests every week. He receives the unconditional support of his wife and his children, who participate in all the activities.

Elmer is an unbanked customer. He came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for his first loan to progressively expand his business and offer a better quality of life to his family. The loan amounts to 1000 new soles and will be used to buy balanced feed for his livestock and fertilizer for his lemon plantation.

Elmer and his family have a good reputation with their neighbors, both as people and as workers.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como docente del nivel secundario y tambien tiene un academia de preparacion para la universidad,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de academia. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su academia como escritorios y pizarras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works as a high school teacher.  He also has an academy for preparing students for university.  He works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and, through this work, he provides for his children.  This member's dream is to expand and improve his academy business.  He is requesting this loan to equip his academy with desks and chalkboards.

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip his academy with desks and chalkboards

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea has run her sari-sari store, or convenience store, for over five years. She sells items like sugar, coffee, soy sauce, vinegar and canned goods. Aurea is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income from the store. She also assists her husband, who is a farmer, by helping to sell his harvest at their town's market.

Aurea is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 23 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single and has no dependents. 

Daisy is engaged in a dietary supplement business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional nutritional supplement products. 

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Daisy hopes to open an outlet for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nutritional supplements to sell.

loans.name: San Luis Sito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre San Luis sito, esta historia es acerca de la señora aleida ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo  cuenta con 27 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 2  hijos Gabriel y José Manuel de los cuales solo el mayor estudia, cursa segundo año de primaria, ya que el menor apenas tiene 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos hace apenas 1 año.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la forma de apoyar a sus pequeños hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, también para contar con una solvencia económica más estable, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de más pollos, para continuar con sus ventas.

La meta que tiene doña aleida es darles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio tanto que está pensando en ahorrar para construir un local y poner su pollería en un lugar estable, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Ella dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad.

Doña aleida da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a Fundación realidad y kiva  por que gracias a ellos podrá mejorar su vida y la de su familia, puesto que ahora tendrán una excelente calidad de vida y solvencia económica.

Las integrantes del grupo san Luis sito y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: clemente-tiene un sonido, José-albañil, aleida-venta de pollos, agustin-pescaderia y Jacob-venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group has the name San Luis Sito. The people who formed it decided to give it this name because this is the name of the community where they live. This story is about Señora Aleida, since she is one of the members of the group. She is 27 years old and is a single mother. She has two children, Gabriel and José Manuel, of whom only the older is in school, in the second year of primary school, since the younger is barely 3 years old. She has been selling chickens almost one year.

She says that she decided to begin this business because she wanted to look for a way to support her little sons and offer them a better quality of life. In addition to this, this business allows her to take care of her children and not neglect them and also to have a more stable financial solvency. She is going to use the loan that she has requested to invest in the purchase of more chickens, to continue with her sales.

Doña Aleida's goal is to give an excellent quality of life to her sons, since she also wants to make her business grow a lot more, to the extent that she is thinking about saving to construct a shop and set up her chicken business in a stable place to improve and increase her earnings.

She says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfill their obligations and very much like to work, to aim ever higher and excel in the face of any difficulty.

Doña Aleida gives thanks in her name and that of her family to Fundación Realidad and Kiva, because thanks to them she will be able to improve her life and that of her family, since now she will have an excellent quality of life and economic solvency.

The members of the group San Luis Sito and their business activities are the following: Clemente, sound business; José, mason; Aleida, selling chickens; Agustin, fish market; and Jacob, selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to continue her sales.

loans.name: La Banda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la Banda  esta integrando por tres mujeres trabajadoras, humildes que desean obtener mas ganancias  y así poder engrandecer sus negocios y mejorar su localidad ofreciéndole mas mercancía para que sus paisanos no tengan que ir a las localidades vecinas a comprar lo que no encuentran en su pueblo.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la profesa Elida  ella da clases en un jardín de niños y se dedica a la venta de papelería y ropa típica  desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el profesor  Yoryino  un señor amable y trabajador quien le ayuda  en atender a los clientes para que se vayan contentos con su mercancía.
Tiene la cantidad de tres  hijos dos mujeres y varón quienes le ayudan a envolver regalos y en forrar cuádrenos ya que  sus hijos están orgullosos de ella por el esfuerzo que hace día con día para darles un mejor futuro.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía para papelería como son: cuadernos, librestas, diccionario.corector papel  china, papel bom, papel lustres, papel  fantasía, lápices, colores  etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Rufina- quien se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes.
Catalina  Alejandrina  -quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las  mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Banda."  It is made up of three hard-working, humble women who hope to increase their incomes, to be able to grow their businesses and to improve their neighborhood by offering more merchandise.  That way the people won't have to go to neighboring areas to purchase things they can't find in their town.
One of the members of this group is Elida, a teacher.  She teaches in a kindergarten and has also made a living for the last three years selling stationary items and traditional clothing.
